results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Please join several dozen professionals for the weekly Sunday 5:30 Contemporary Mass at Holy Trinity Church conveniently located on the upper west side of Manhattan!  This mass is a great way to top off your week with relationship building with God and your peers.

Holy Trinity Church

213 West 82nd Street

Between Amsterdam and Broadway

Every Sunday after mass we gather in front of church for some socializing before heading over to a pre decided venue.  Why not become part of a growing, warm, welcoming and cohesive community!

results.description:
Ultra Sound Rehearsal Studios251 West 30th Street, New York, NY[masked]th Floor Studio 5

Come join us for our music meetup. A gathering of musicians and singers of all levels, all types of music, amateur or professional in a studio space at Ultra Sound Rehearsal Studios. The room fees for this meetup is compliments of Wannabe Music. The location can be mapped here. 

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Ultra+Sound+Rehearsal+Studio/@40.7494801,-73.9964881,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c259ae2cc3776d:0xa9a3f7823ec105b4 . We will be working on a few songs which are listed below. We are open to requests, so please chime in with your RSVP on what you would like to play and we can accommodate. If you are having issues finding where to add this information in your RSVP. Please leave a message below and indicate what you like to work on.

More information on the studio and the the equipment included are here....

http://www.ultrasoundrehearsal.com/studios/studio5.html

This is a last minute scheduling just because I had the time felt like playing and meeting other fellow musicians in a new space. We will have it 5:40 to 8:20PM on Sunday, November 1, 2015. Hope you can all make it.

Some suggestions for songs we can work on are below. Sheet music, lyric sheets, and Chord Charts are all in a zip for each song and will be linked to the song shortly (if not already).

Pride (In The Name of Love) by U2

Naive by The Kooks

Little Red Corvette by Prince

I Wanna Be Sedated by The Ramones

Are You Gonna Be My Girl by Jet

Learn to Fly by Foo Fighters

You're A God by Vertical Horizon

Sex on Fire by Kings of Leon

Looking forward to meeting you all!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the sign on the door when entering the studio for directions
results.name: Music Meetup at Ultra Sound Rehearsal Studios

results.description:
SWINGIN' SUNDAYS - WEST COAST SWING LESSONS AND DANCE

every 1st, 3rd, & 5th Sunday

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

BEGINNER AND INTERMEDIATE LESSONS: 6:00-6:45 PM

from 9/7-12/7, the intermediate lesson will be a performance class, see details below

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

-BEGINNERS WELCOME! We have a Basic lesson to start the night and some fantastic local instructors on hand to guide you, so tell ALL your friends!

-Featuring a wonderful mix of rotating DJs.

-Low cost, high fun at a nice venue

-Only $7 before 5:15 PM for more than 4 hours of dancing fun :-)

-2 Lessons: Basic & Intermediate at 6:00 PM

-Dance Party starts at 6:45 PM and goes 'till 12:00 AM

-$7 before 5:15 PM, $12 after

***************************************************************

------IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT------From 9/7/14-12/7/14-----

In place of the intermediate class, we'll be offering an intermediate level routine and performance opportunity.

We will be teaching and cleaning the routine on 9/7, 9/21, 10/5, 10/19, 11/2, 11/16, 11/30

You will perform in the show on Sunday, December 7th.

There is NO CHARGE for the class!

All you need to do is pay for the admission to the dance and show up by 6:00 PM!

 

What YOU get out of this:

1) The opportunity to perform for a group of supportive dancers

2) The opportunity to learn, practice, and utilize skills that help you understand musicality, presentation, partnering, and phrasing.

3) A TON OF FUN

What We Need From YOU:

1) Just YOU - partner NOT required

2) The choreography will be taught over the first 5 sessions. You need to be in attendance at least 3 of the first 5 Sundays. You also need to attend the review sessions on the last two Sundays (11/16 & 11/30). So in total, of the 7 choreography sessions, you need to attend at least 5.

***************************************************************

All night drinks specials!

* $6 Sangria

* $16 1/2 Carafe of Sangria

* $5 Corona

* $2 Bottle of Water

 

LOCATION:

Dancesport

22 West 34th St, btw 5 & 6 Av

4th floor

Look forward to seeing you there!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pssssst: This dance is part of a collaboration of multiple dance styles using the same venue to offer different dance styles all at the same time. There's Bachata, Salsa, Zouk, Kizomba, and West Coast Swing all happening at the SAME place, at the SAME time, for the SAME price! So, you have the chance to check out FIVE different dances all for the price of 1!  The evening starts with a Bachata Lesson at 5:00 PM.  For More Information:  https://www.facebook.com/events/308507872585674/

results.description:
TNYA Water Polo is an LGBTQ friendly team with practices at John Jay College Friday 7:30 – 9:00 pm, Sunday from 6:00 – 7:30 pm, and Tuesday 8:00 or 9:00 - 10:00 pm at the Chelsea Rec Center (for Rec Center members only). For full information on the team, please go to www.tnya.org. 

The first practice is free and we love getting new players! Please let the coach on deck know if it's your first time with us and feel free to message Alex Barclay ahead of time if you have any questions. You will need to bring a swim suit appropriate for water polo, a towel, goggles and a lock. If you would like to practice with us regularly, you must become registered with US Water Polo at the silver level and pay our annual membership dues.

We ask that any practice participants have some prior experience playing water polo and be able to swim a hundred yards in a row in less than two minutes. If you have a swimming background and are interested in learning water polo, please read the pdf below thoroughly and contact Alex Barclay. The coaching is typically geared to an intermediate level of play and we do work on basic skills at every practice. Everyone should be familiar with the basic rules and concepts of the game, as outlined in this pdf: http://www.tnya.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Polo_Beginners.pdf

Practices typically include a swim set and some conditioning at the beginning, drills, and scrimmaging for the last 30-45 minutes (it's also ok to sit out for the scrimmaging portion if it's your first practice). Bob or Jeff are the typical coaches. We strive to create a positive and welcoming environment and do not tolerate any unsportsmanlike conduct. There are at least four tournaments we compete in each year and practices will adjust in the weeks before the tournaments to prepare participating players.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk in. Pool is straight ahead. Tell the desk you're there for water polo.
results.name: TNYA Water Polo

results.description:
This is the first in a series of bimonthly dinners at the Bahche. 

An opportunity to have informal conversations on anything psychedelic. Whether you want to talk about the science, the history, or your personal journey, this will be a place for you. 

This is a large space, so we don’t have to cap attendance. Depending on how many people come, we can split into groups or sit at the same table.

Look forward to seeing you all there!

PLEASE NOTE: We do NOT engage in or promote illegal activities during our Meetups. Don't join this group to procure, or otherwise attempt to procure illegal substances.
results.name: Dinner and Conversation

results.description:
Prepay at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5930 is required. 

Sunday, NOVEMBER 1st @ 6 PM 
(Premingle at 4:30 PM) 

**Exclusive Private tour for our group.. The museum will be closed to the public** 


Museum of the American Gangster Tour for Singles

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FiRbqNyVskg 


This is a great event where you can step back in time and relive the days of the American Gangster.  At the same time, meet some fun singles, make some new friends and maybe more at this great  event.

==================================================== 

How it works 

The tour starts at 6 PM SHARP, however we will have a pre-mingle at 4:30 at a local bar/pub (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

Next we head to the museum for a Guided Group Tour.  

Note: This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. 

=============================================== 
Itinerary

4:30 PM- Premingle to meet other attendees

*6PM- Group Tour

================================================== 

About the Museum:

Housed in a former speakeasy, the Museum of the American Gangster isn’t obvious on a casual stroll down St. Mark’s Place. If visitors know to look for number 80, though, they pass through a black gate and up a flight of stairs, where a plethora of artifacts and exhibits awaits. The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills.


- BUY TICKETS
results.name: Museum of American GANGSTER tour/ pre-Mingle - (Must Prepay)

group.name: Alternative to the Bar Fun Things To Do In NYC Today!

results.description:
This event is hosted by Date Walking - The Easiest Way to Meet Someone Special.  


Join a bunch of singles in their 50s and 60's from multiple Meetup groups for a Singles Pizza Crawl. 

What is this Date Walking I keep hearing about? See the answer here: http://datewalking.nyc 

What is a pizza crawl and how does it work? It goes like this: We will be visiting 3 award-winning pizza places within a relatively short walking distance from each other that serve slices. We will consume a slice and then head to the next place to consume another slice and so on. When we have completed our pizza-eating crawl we can move onto more important matters, like drinking.


For those of you who can't or don't want to eat 3 slices, I have a solution: You can buddy up with someone and split slices so by the end of the crawl you will only have eaten 1 and a half slices. Problem solved. 

We will meet at 6 PM at the base of the Washington Square Park Arch and get to know each other for 30 minutes. Be advised that if you show up even 1 minute late you will miss us.  

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing at the base of the Washington Square Park Arch</a> and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your <a href="http://www.meetup.com/DateWalking/">Date Walk organizer. If you are unsure you can call Beau at[masked] and he will wave you over to where the group is. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the group of people standing at the base of the Washington Square Park Arch and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. If you are unsure you can call Beau at 347-225-3516
results.name: Singles Pizza Crawl + Date Walk | Age 50+

results.description:
We will be hosting our 2015/2016 indoor doubles tennis season at Cary Leeds Tennis Center!  (<a>Click here for directions</a>).

Each session will consist of 2 hours of competitive doubles tennis on Sunday nights from 6pm to 8pm. 


Here's what you need to know:

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE LEVEL [3.0]
The required level for this meetup is 3.0. In other words, you should understand the rules of doubles tennis and be able to serve and hit groundstrokes consistently. 

If you are a beginner that's still learning the basics, unfortunately this meetup isn't for you. For those beginners, I am working on an indoor option for you... stay tuned. 

RSVPing + FEE
The fee for our indoor meetups is $20. This fee needs to be paid upfront to solidify your RSVP.  After you RSVP, you will have 24 hours to make a payment. If the payment is not made, I will remove your RSVP to make room for someone else.

Each meetup will start with a 4-person RSVP limit. I am booking one court at a time this year. Once the first court is booked and paid for. I will open up the RSVP list for the next court. DO NOT BE DETERRED BY A WAITING LIST!

PAYMENT INSTRUCTIONS
While I would prefer to use meetup's option for payment, the fees they charge would make it less cost effective for everyone involved. So, I will contact everyone individually (or through the meetup comments) to request payments via PayPal. 

My PayPal email address is [masked]. 

WHAT SHOULD I BRING?
Bring your racquet + a fresh brand new can of tennis balls. 

WHAT WILL HAPPEN DURING THE MEETUP?
First, you will be assigned to a court.
There will be a 10-minute warmup.
After that, we will begin play.

RULES DURING PLAY
Standard USTA rules will apply with the following provisions:
1 Set Matches
No-AD games (this means there will be no deuce. At 40 all, whoever wins the next point takes the game.)
If the set goes to 6 all, you will play a No-AD tiebreak (first to 7 wins).

WHAT HAPPENS WHEN WE FINISH A SET?
After your set is complete, you will stay on the same court and switch partners with the other team.  I intend to have this planned out beforehand so expect an organized sets of matches for the night.

ANYMORE QUESTIONS?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
"Tuning the mind, body, and soul"-Gaynor

The sound and silence meditation group meets every Sunday. The meditation begins with 30 min. of  toning*, 30 minutes of silent meditation, In the last 10 min. there is time for a brief discussion, questions, or sharing.


According to Gaynor (1999, p. [masked]), "Sounds enters the healing equation from several different directions: It may alter cellular functions through energetic effects; it may entrain biological systems to function more homeostatically; it may becalm the mind and therefore the body; or it may have emotional effects, which influence neurotransmitters and neuropeptides, which in turn help regulate the immune system-the healer within. Music is organized sound that has potent emotional effects and stimulates memories, associations, and highly developed  psychological states with clear impact on our healing systems."

 Toning* in your own voice is a very powerful tool for self-healing, relaxation, personal growth, opening creativity, and helping to balance life experiences.Toning is the elongation of a note or tone using breath and voice to assist you to get still enough to meditate.
It is great.....
• If you have a difficult time getting still enough to meditate;
• If you desire higher states of consciousness;
• If your communication energy center seems blocked;
• If you breathe too shallowly;
• If you need immediate grief or stress relief;
• If you're depressed;
• If you need more confidence or zest;
• If you have trouble listening, focusing or being in the moment

We look forward to seeing you at the next scheduled meet-up!Please e-mail me at [masked] if you have any questions or concerns.

Every week dozens of CRC members and friends gather to socialize, network and connect following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity. It is a great way for new members and those who have been coming out for a while to meet others in our community.  This week we invite you join us in the parish center under the church for a free Pizza Party! 


Please RSVP so we can figure out how many pies to get.

Can I come alone?  Yes, many people come on their own.  We will have council members looking out for new members to introduce to others.

What if I belong to another parish or went to an earlier mass?  That's fine, just come for the party.

How should I dress?  Like you did for mass

What is the cost and what is included?  There is no cost but if you would like to make a donation we will accept it!

We do ask that you consume responsibly so that everyone can have something!


How long do you guys stay?  Usually till about 8:30-9pm

Come share about the effects of unhealthy relationships in your life.

We will also share and do role playing around about what a healthy relationship looks like and how we can begin to have a healthier relationship with ourselves.

There will be a meditation, sharing, educational readings, role playing and fun activities as well as support for each other.

This week's special-bring a friend get half off the session.

 Do you find yourself attracting people who are unavailable, incapable of treating you with the love and respect you deserve?

Do you have difficulties making healthy choices?

 Would you like to view your relationships in a new and different perspective?

Unhealthy relationships can be experienced with intimate partners as well as with friends, parents, siblings, children or work relationships. Meet others struggling with the same issues. Have fun, feel safe and supported while experiencing meditation, deep sharing, role-playing, educational readings and structured exercises.

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session

  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=633153420</a>

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125361<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631567294">

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.

10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
"It was deep it was soulful, it was techno, it was disco, a kaleidoscope of sounds, it was truly underground. It was an essential mix in the cloud where we could dance and sing out loud. It was New York, Ibiza and Miami all wrapped up into one. There were speakers the size of skyscrapers and the stars they flickered like strobes, and everybody loved everybody else...I must have went to house heaven, because nothing’s that divine."                                                       

—Roland Clark

That’s right, we’re calling on all our DJ's to contribute for our weekly radio shows broadcast www.soundboxonline.com. What better way to keep those decks moving and keeping them from stagnating by pooling the tracks that tickle your fancy and inspire you as a DJ.


A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus. 


Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.


• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps. 

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!


• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show


• A great profile pic


So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Also send us a picture, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.


Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G. 

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]

results.description:
A message from John:

I have noticed there are models that have joined the group that would like to start modeling with TheModels’Den (TMD). 

If you are a model and you want become a TMD Model you need to be interviewed and attend this casting call.

Please note the interviews and test shoots start at 3:30pm and end promptly at 6:00pm The last model intake will be at 5:00pm. When you RSVP you will be contacted for an approximate start time. 

Be prepared to be interviewed like you are applying for a job, not a modeling position. I am not looking for one time models but models that want to work consistently; that are team players; can collaborate with other models and have traits to work independently. 

What I look for in the interview: personality, personality, personality! It is imperative that applicants be naturally hospitable! Models must be honest, with a good sense of street smarts and have business sense; be a problem solver and resourceful; have a creative mind; and be a good communicator and responsible. ( RELIABLE with punctuality at the top of the list falls in line with being responsible). 

Bring a resume if you have. I’m looking for experience in any job or school. Have you ever volunteered for community service, helped organize events, played in a band, or do you have dancing experience, etc..?

What to expect as a model in TheModels’Den:

If you think that getting paid $200 for 2-1/2 hours is what it’s about, Then this job is not for you. You are an independent model with TMD promoting you. You will only succeed if you put all your effort into the events. It means: taking the time to be creative, research and scout venues, contact studios, make reservations, post your events and be in constant contact with members to listen to their suggestions and see if you can produce an event they request. 

This takes time and the photographers know it. Take shortcuts and it can be clearly seen at the events. That is why I am actively involved with the planning process until the model develops a constant work flow. 

In most cases for every hour an event is in length: it takes just a long to plan it and then some. 

STOP! If you want to model only and not put the work into it the prep, you best not apply. 

TMD offers models the opportunity to choose their own hours, pay, location and the type of modeling they want to do. All in the environment they choose. They decide whether to use a hairstylist or use a make-up artist. 

TMD offers photographers the opportunity to attend an event that is not overcrowded but an event that is well managed with photographers limited to a specific amount ( typically 3) where only one photographer is shooting at one time. 

Photographers are not required to provide pictures to models, saving the photographer countless of hours of editing. Editing only because they feel obligated to!

TMD recognizes that events like these are the photographers safe haven where they can come and practice, experiment, try new techniques or new equipment without having to be committed to anyone. Beginners and pros come for that purpose. 

WHY FREE MODELING IS NOT GOOD For anyone: 

For the photographer - Free model means trade for pictures. The problem is that time is money and editing pictures end up costing more money than paying a model. 

For the model - waiting for a trade in most cases ends up being a disappointment. The photos are not what they expected and in many cases they just don’t receive pictures. 

TRANSPARENCY is important at TMD - we value everyones time! We find the best models that can model effectively that show up, are willing to accommodate reasonable requests that permit the photographer to try new approaches that allows the photographer to improve their skills.

And sometimes the images just don't come out as expected! Lesson learned and we all still end up a happy family — on to the next event!
results.name: TMD CASTING CALL - Need Models

results.description:
Join Michael Rosenblum, founder of the New York Video School (www.nyvs.com) and author of 'iPhone Millionaire," as he explores what it takes to start your own video production business. Drawing from his wealth of experience working with BBC, The Voice of America, NYT Television, the Travel Channel Academy and more, Michael explains how we are at a critical point in the development of the video creation industry. With tips from his book, Michael will demonstrate just how easy it is for you to start and grow your own video production business this day and age.

This presentation will be held as two (2) repeat sessions - once at 4:00 PM and again at 6:00 PM. Please RSVP for the session that you'd like to attend.

ABOUT MICHAEL:
For more than 25 years, Mr. Rosenblum has been on the cutting edge of the digital videojournalist revolution. During this time, he has led a drive for video literacy, and the complete rethinking of how television and online video is made and controlled. A regular blogger for The Guardian (UK) and The Huffington Post, Michael is the author of Videojournalismus (Germany) and iPhone Millionaire: Six Weeks To Change Your Life (McGraw Hill 2012). His work has help found and shape the BBC's national network,  the Voice of America, NYT Television, and more.
results.name: Start Your Own Video Production Business With Michael Rosenblum

The next NY Nonprofit Accounting Meetup will be held on Mon, November 2nd. This promises to be a very interesting and informative session. 


We are very lucky to have as our guest speaker, Paula Park, who will be speaking to the group about "How to Make Yourself Attractive to Banks."

Paula Park is a Senior Relationship Manager for Nonprofit and Higher Education Sectors with BankUnited. A banking industry veteran with 25 years of experience, Paula has focused much of her career on managing the banking needs of tax-exempt organizations. Most recently, she served as senior vice president of the education and nonprofit banking group, northeast region at Wells Fargo Bank in Manhattan.

Due to space restrictions, this meeting will be limited to 65 attendees. Registration 5:30, Presentation & Questions 6pm - 6:45, Networking 6:45-8pm. Drinks and light refreshments will be served. Please feel free to forward this to other potentially interested people. The event is currently posted on Eventbrite, so if you plan on attending, you must <a>RSVP here</a>. 

 Also, if you are not yet a member of our LinkedIn group, <a>feel free to join</a> to stay up to date on the discussion and other group events.

results.description:
Route to be determined that day.  This is a fast paced workout and less of a social event due to the cooler temps and earlier sunset.  Due to the potential of hiking in the dark, the group will be limited in size. If you have attended Monday Bear Mountain hikes with me regularly, I will add you. That being said, I reserve the right to remove you if I am not familiar with you or your abilities. If the  questions are not answered, I will also remove you from the going list.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water.  If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of a fast paced event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
45 minutes of diving into the teachings, techniques, and practice of Meditation, for new and experienced Meditators.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Let's meet up and Meditate

results.description:
We will be reimbursing you for your train ticket. Please keep your receipt! There will be a shuttle taking you between the train station and the hearing. 

To arrive in Long Beach by 6pm, the trains leave at 4:40pm or 5pm. However, come even if you will be late. It doesn't matter what time you arrive, it just matters that you come! Train schedule 

This is our last chance to send a powerful message to Governor Cuomo urging him to veto this dangerous proposal!

Port Ambrose is a liquefied natural gas (LNG) port that has been proposed for the New York Harbor. 

This project would damage our marine ecosystem, place us at risk from terrorist attacks, and promote the industrialization of our coastline. It is also proposed for the same site as a wind farm. Port Ambrose would block a green, clean, renewable source of energy.

Fortunately, Governor Cuomo, as well as New Jersey's Governor Christie, has the authority to veto the project.

We need EVERYONE to turn out and send a message to Governor Cuomo that we will not allow our oceans and beaches to be put in danger. The time is now....tell Cuomo to veto Port Ambrose!

Port Ambrose Final Hearing

November 2nd, 2015

6pm-10pm

Long Beach Hotel, 405 East Broadway, Long Beach, 11561

We'll be there along with our friends at Food & Water Watch, Surfrider Central Long Island Chapter, Sane Energy Project, Clean Ocean Action, United for Action, Catskill MountainKeeper
results.name: Port Ambrose Final Hearing

results.description:
The Grassroots Alliance has long worked to stop Port Ambrose LNG. These are the FINAL PUBLIC HEARINGS in NY. This is our last official chance to say NO to this project. We really need everyone to attend and testify. 

The NJ hearings take place on Nov 4+5. November 6th opens the 45-day window for the governors to veto Port Ambrose. If the governors do not act, it's an automatic approval. To get them to veto it, we need massive turnout at each hearing. More info about Port Ambrose here. 

This is a crucial project to kill: If it passes, it's a deal breaker for the Rockaway wind farm. That would be a massive loss: for green energy, for green jobs, for the safety and welfare of the entire NYC and Long Island communities.  

The January hearings were held in a remote location on an icy, zero-degree day, and we STILL had 600 people present. Let's double those numbers this time!


Long Beach is an easy ride from Penn Station or Atlantic terminal in Brooklyn. The hotel is a 19-minute walk from the LIRR station in Long Beach, and groups are working on arranging shuttle cars and possibly buses for those who can't make the walk. Stay tuned for more about that later. 

Please just plan on being there by any means you can. Also please attend the training on Monday, Oct 26th (see that meetup to RSVP for that).
results.name: TESTIFY AGAINST PORT AMBROSE LNG

results.description:
Topic: EDI

Electronic data interchange (EDI) is the computer-to-computer exchange of business documents between companies. EDI replaces the faxing and mailing of paper documents.

EDI documents use specific computer record formats that are based on widely accepted standards. However, each company will use the flexibility allowed by the standards in a unique way that fits their business needs.

Linda will demonstrate a project that uses data in an EDI format.

The project includes:

• Locating the data.

• Filter form.

• Selecting zip codes to be used in the data base.

The Microsoft Conference Center, is free of charge, at 41st Street and 8th Avenue, (NorthEast corner... i.e. not in Port Authority). Ignore the note on this page, which says, "Max: 1 person". We never max out room capacity. The reason it says it's maxed out, is because I can't sign you up through meetup.com. To RSVP, please send an email to: LindaEwen at nyc dot rr dot com, with your first and last name. We plan on meeting on the 1st Monday of every month, but occasionally there are changes. You should receive an email, if there's a change. I suggest you print out any email response you receive, even though it's not required. The Conference Center's security department, requires your first and last name, so please include your full name, within the body of your email. A photo ID is mandatory. Sometimes, the map on this meetup link above, is incorrect, so please write down the address. If you don't get an email back from anyone, within a day or two, please send a 2nd request.It's OK, to be half an hour early and use the free coffee machine. Try to go early, if it's your first time, in case you are not registered properly. If you arrive, and the the security personnel informs you of a registration problem, don't be alarmed, they will assist you. Please be patient, (no seating limitation). For those who sent their first email request, on the day of the event, this process may take half an hour, and the cut off time for confirmation is 7:00 PM. If you would like to use meetup to remind yourself, find the duplicate listing of this event at http://www.meetup.com/Spreadsheets/events/calendar/

Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

  Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

   People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

   I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members: I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey
results.how_to_find_us: The electronic billboard at the studio will show the up-to-date room.
results.name: Voice / Singing Class -- Regular Monday Time

venue.address_1: 142 Main Street (corner of Franklin and Main - the entrance is off the rear parking lot)
venue.name: Helen Hayes Studios

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners).  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

Since PUNTO Space is a new performance and events venue with space to rent to artists and also the home of the resident theater company, Nettles Artists Collective, we decided to kick-off a series of performance labs! For our firstMeetUp, we thought a social media cheat sheet lab was a great way to show our space off because with so many demands on artists and an abyss of social media options, we couldn't help but wonder if there wasn't a social media shortcut that could make our lives a little easier.  

Performing arts professionals, artists and actors, we are thrilled to invite you to join PUNTO Space and the Nettles Artists Collective, in a social media cheat sheet lab presented by Kissing Lions Public Relations.

Anyone who knows PUNTO Space, knows we love the arts! All performing arts professionals welcome!

At PUNTO Space, we know how essential it is to stay in an authentic place as an artist while you share your story in your own unique way on media platforms you understand.  It's not always easy for performers to navigate, but that is why it's especially important to have creative resources, camaraderie within your creative community and the ability to collaborate in a space that embraces who you are!  

To attend this FREE MeetUp, you must RSVP above and join our group.  Take a look HERE!

Book your rehearsal space at PUNTOSpace.com or call[masked]

Using Ecommerce tools, like WixStores, allows you as a small business owner or entrepreneur to easily build a stunning online store and become an effective merchant! Join David "Dedi" Scwartz VP of Ecommerce, Boost and Bookings as he provides you with key insights and actionable information such as:

1. The importance of stunning ecommernce store design as a tool to solve the trust crises for small merchants 

2. Everyone can sell - How diy tools can allow anyone to easily start an online store

3. Be an effective merchant - What tools are out there that can allow you to drive more traffic to your ecommerce store

About the Speaker:

David "Dedi" Schwartz is VP of eCommerce, Bookings and Boost at Wix. David is the successful founder of several start-ups including Jogli (DMG), PeerApp Technologies, and WebMap Technologies. Drawing on his vast and diverse experience, David has guest lectured throughout the high-tech industry as well as at the Hebrew University MBA program on issues ranging from product development and management to marketing and innovation trends. 


About the Venue:

Thank you to Wix.com for hosting us at the Wix Lounge. Wix.com enables you to build a free and professional online presence, just the way you want it. With an HTML5 drag-and-drop website editor, 100s of web apps, designer-made templates, and tons of features, Wix gives you the tools to launch and manage your online presence.

So what are you waiting for? Sign up for a free Wix workshop today!

The Alley Boost Expo VIP Mixer will be a private mixer the day before the Alley Boost Startup Expo that will be made up of exhibitors, sponsors, press, and investors. We are making 50 tickets available to the general public.

The evening will be made up of startup/tech networking and story sharing. If you don't have a specific agenda, hang out and mingle with like-minded folks and enjoy the great atmosphere. Who knows who you'll meet or what you'll learn! You must be 21+ to attend.

You can learn more about the Expo here - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/alley-boost-startup-expo-tickets-17364991156

Thank you to our sponsors!

Businesses are dynamic. Commercial Real estate is not. PivotDesk is an office-sharing marketplace that matches offices with excess space to companies that need it. Flexible agreements eliminate the risk of a long-term lease, allowing entrepreneurs to offset costs so they can focus on what's most important—growing their business. 


Moisan Legal P.C. utilizes technology to foster a collaborative client/attorney interaction. Our goal is to be your ongoing strategic resource and enable your business to operate effectively. 

For nearly 20 years, Premier has been the Bay Area's go-to staffing resource for the emerging growth and tech industries. Today, Premier brings their expertise to New York City, where they continue to place rockstar candidates in the functional areas of Administration, Operations, HR and Sales. From Contract/Temp to Contract-to-hire and Direct hire, Premier helps disruptive companies find the best talent to fuel the growth of their business. 


TeachCode was developed through piloting an introductory, standards-based Python curriculum at a high-needs urban school. The pilot study showed that detailed materials, paced appropriately with proper support, yielded positive results for teachers and students who had never written code before. TeachCode was developed to address the needs of business teachers or others who want to help children learn about code and STEM, but who do not have the skills in technology to develop age appropriate, differentiated curriculum and assessments.

The TeachCode curriculum is created by educator, software test engineer, and TeachCode founder Dr. Jessica Ingrassellino. Jessica has taught the teach code curriculum in schools to students from sixth through twelfth grades, and she feels strongly that learning to code should be available to both teachers and students for low or no cost. 

TeachCode seeks to bring the opportunity to learn code to people in the most underserved communities: people who are consumers of technology, but who might not get to create with or for that technology. Additionally, TeachCode seeks to bring communities together through partnerships between colleges, K-12 schools, and TeachCode, to create a supportive learning environment that inspires students, supports teachers, and encourages lifelong learning for all.

Vantagon is a technology company focused in developing software solutions for collaboration and research. Unlocking the potential in Life Sciences breakthroughs with better data management and artificial intelligence, as well as providing productivity solutions through Taskflight, its enterprise management app for tasks and objectives.

Hey Bartender! Take Monday off! 

Mise Technologies, the premier developers of applications for bars and restaurants, has just released Stockboy. Stockboy is our subscription-based inventory management app for iOS and Android devices. With Stockboy, bartenders are able to perform inventory, find the best suppliers, create and send POs, and generate reports on usage and cost of goods sold. What once took hours will now take mere minutes, saving you not only money but some sweet, sweet time. 

Stockboy, it's everything you need for inventory management in one place.

A LEAN Business increases Cash Flow, Productivity, Customer Satisfaction and Profits with one simple activity. Taking time to understand: What are we doing? Why are we doing it? And howwell are we doing it? Monitoring your business processes will prevent “waste and inefficiencies” from choking the business and unlock the growth and profits desired.

Using the LEAN methodology, we can help you simplify processes, identify problems and fix them. We also train your business managers, project managers and analysts how to use tools to keep your business LEAN.

Attend a Free Webinar on “How to Create a Lean Business” – Register at http://myleanbiz.com/freewebinar

Contact us today to learn more! (718)[masked] --[masked] 

Washington Law is a boutique law firm representing startups, small businesses, and individuals. We invest in developing long-term client relationships and take pride in providing tailored, cost-effective strategies to meet our clients'’ needs. The firm represents a wide range of clients including tech startups, entrepreneurs, investment firms, real estate companies and fashion and beauty lines. With a broad array of experience in practice areas including business law, intellectual property, technology, civil litigation, media, estate planning, and real estate, we provide effective, knowledgeable counsel to tomorrow's business leaders.

This is a great class for beginner Spanish speakers. The cost is only $175 for the entire semester! Please email or send a message to confirm that we are still accepting new students.

Level 1 is an introduction to the Spanish language. Students will learn to form and answer simple questions and hold simple conversations on topics such as family, home, food, health and employment. Through interactive dialogues, games and songs, the structure of simple sentences in the present tense will be practiced.

El Nivel 1 de español es una introducción al lenguaje.  Los estudiantes aprenderán a formar y contestar preguntas sencillas y a mantener conversaciones sencillas sobre temas como la familia, el hogar, la alimentación, la salud y el empleo.  A través de diálogos interactivos, juegos y cantos, se practicará la estructura de oraciones sencillas en el tiempo verbal presente.

English 3 students will already have a working knowledge of the basics of English conversation and will be able to read and to write simple paragraphs.  They will be introduced to compound verb tenses. The principal objectives of Level 3 are to enhance the students’ fluency, their vocabularies and their comprehension of spoken and written English.  Students will actively participate in activities drawn from real life.

Inglés Nivel 3 alumnos ya tendrán un conocimiento práctico de los conceptos básicos de conversación en inglés y serán capaces de leer y escribir párrafos simples. Los alumnos también serán introducidos a la combinación de los tiempos verbales. Los principales objetivos de nivel 3 son mejorar la fluidez de los estudiantes, mejorar el vocabulario y mejorar la comprensión general de inglés hablado y escrito. Los estudiantes participarán en actividades similares a varias posibilidades de comunicación en inglés en la vida real.

results.description:
Our small, yet intrepid band of heroes returns to Everlund, staggeringly powerful, evil, magical artifact in tow. Their intent is to do as they were instructed and deliver the artifact to the grubby hands of the one who hired / coerced them to retrieve it in the first place.

But their travel plans are interrupted. They meet a rather troublesome elf named Danis and agree to travel with him. But this alliance lasts less than a full day and night when Danis attempts to pilfer the mage's spellbook. He's exiled from the group...so to speak.

The bigger problem they have is an overwhelming fog that has clouded their journey. When it finally lifts, they learn they're not in Elysia anymore. And that's when the werewolves come.

results.description:
Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly/Scrabble/Risk/etc. Be adventurous and come learn some new games that will change the way you think about board games!

We begin gathering around 6pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

results.description:
You are invited to join us for a data science study session. On Monday, November 2, we will kick off with an introduction on Gaussian processes. We will explore Gaussian process regression as an efficient way to optimize a system's parameters, not only for machine learning problems, but also in our day-to-day lives.


Image: Aol building entrance

Image: Aol floor plan (we'll be at Roebling)


Before you attend, here is a preparation checklist:

1. Sign up for a github account. This will allow us to more easily share code and collaborate together. (https://github.com/)


2. Make sure you can log in to our chat room with your github account. This is the place to ask questions. (https://gitter.im/NYDSSG/chat)


3. Join our google mailing list. This will allow you to access and contribute to the tutorial list that the group is working on. More importantly, this lets you team up with other students on tutorials that are interesting to you.


Our goal is to create a friendly and productive environment where we can build skills together with fellow data scientists. It doesn't matter if you use Python, R, or Excel, have 2 years of experience or 2 days, everyone is welcome to join. But to make it worth your time, check out the tutorial list FIRST. Pair up in a group if you see something interesting. Otherwise, add a tutorial so that others can join you. It's more fun to learn together.


Many thanks to Aol, who is graciously lending us their space.


We look forward to seeing you on Monday!


Here is our current tutorial list.

results.description:
RSVP

http://form.jotformpro.com/form/52805976850971

Currently, over 50 percent of the world’s population lives in cities. By 2050 over two-thirds of people will reside in urban environments. Although city living has many advantages, residing in cities is often associated with a high cost of living, and high crime rates, and large population density. Research has also shown that people who grow up in cities process negative emotions such as stress differently from those who move to the city as adults. These and other factors often result in severe or prolonged stress. Could the stress of city life be increasing the risk of mental health disorders? Does city living make the brain more susceptible to mental health conditions? Do people living in cities and rural areas differ in the way that their brains process stressful situations? If scientists are able to detect which aspects of city life are most stressful, these findings may help to improve the way urban areas are designed. Please join our speakers as they discuss these and other significant questions affecting stress and the city.

Events are intended for people who identify as women, which includes trans women. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc.

So what exactly IS this group? This is a weekly group of intermediates and advanced participants. We meet every Monday and provide you with the space to continue your project or ideas of projects you can work on with other attendees over a period of several weeks and help for when you get stuck.

If you are an intermediate or advanced member and would like either demo a project or try teaching, please reach out to [masked]!

results.description:
Here it is! The work days end with darkness now and for most of us it becomes a dreary time of limited activities to do. With the weather forecasted to be in the mid to high 50's at night, this event is going to be heaven!

- SEE THE INCENTIVE BELOW - 

Monday is coming and I'm offering a workshop limited to 6 photographers. I have Monica, a model from TheModels'Den, attending as the specimen to be worked on ;) She is up for torture! To work in a workshop is not that easy, so let me thank Monica now while she is still talking to me... Thank you Monica :-)

Join us this Monday From 6:15pm to 9:15pm and if we get a full house it may go to 9:30pm

A great workshop on the use of 2 off camera flashes -
In the first 45 minutes it will be a solid lesson on light positioning, filters, and working with ambient light. 
Learn how to adjust the flash intensities for proper exposure.

Then the lesson continues as we move from Time Square to a nearby street alley.  Watch how a simple street can be turned into an illusive nightmare. 

Wish I could invite more photographers.. but quality of the lesson is most important to that of quantity of students.  Each will have time to have hands on shooting, but it doesn't mean if you are not shooting you are not doing, at least not with me it doesn't.  When I teach, everyone is involved in each shot taken. You will see the results, see how and why so you can replicate your own visions in the many shooting opportunities the TMD Models will be offering. 

Of course it's $109  - that's 1 model and 1 instructor giving you a darn good 3 hour lesson.  There is no early bird, no discounts and this event will not cancel regardless of how many people show up.  

If my flash triggers do not function on your camera, you will be shooting with my Nikon Df. You will love shooting with it too! You might just not give it back. Hmm, maybe not a good idea.

Payment is due in full upon your RSVP.

Recommended lenses: 
Wide prime! or at least a wide zoom with f2.8 

Normal lense, hopefully prime or zoom in that range having a 2.8

Tele - 200mm best being a f2.8 

Don't have a fast lens?... not to worry, your quality will suffer as we bump up your ISO and the bokeh won't be as delicious but at least you will come out with some serious new found knowledge and the hunger for some fast lenses. 

========================================

Some of you know me well: I am a sick puppy. I don't stop teaching and I can keep going to the wee hours if people didn't have jobs to go to.  I plan to persuade some of you to keep going after the shoot! 

Monica won't be so willing, I'm sure, especially after 3 hours of being tormented. But I have plans to head to Mcdonalds that's open 24 hours or any other whole in the wall that has a plug for my laptop. For those of you that want to be completely irresponsible to lose a few hours sleep I'll be uploading selected images to discuss varying techniques to edit and post process.  Keep buying me coffee and I'll keep going... Last train out of NYC to NJ is my only restriction. 

Here's a bit of an incentive:

Book this workshop and TMD will offer you $20 off any of Monica's events to the end of this year that she offers through http://www.meetup.com/TheModelsDen-NewYork/.  If she doesn't host at least 3 events for you to take advantage of before the end of the year, I'll make it so you can use the $20 towards any model in January! So it is written so it be done.

So come! RSVP now. 


Cheers! John
results.how_to_find_us: You will see the group with camera's and backpacks. hard to miss. My cell - 347-746-2001 (john)
results.name: WORKSHOP - Getting Prepped for night photography & multiple flashes

results.description:
With Git you can make it look like you’re the perfect programmer - one who never makes a mistake! 

In this fast paced, terminal driven session, learn advanced techniques for undoing almost anything with Git. Starting from the safety of a revert, we’ll dabble with commit –amend, three types of reset and the dreaded reflog. We’ll also look at rebase -i and how to undo things like a merge commit or even a fast forward merge.


Join us for this demo-driven session presented by Peter Bell, Founder and CEO of Wheelhouse.io.
results.name: How to undo anything with Git

results.description:
Implementing a practical REST-based API can be a challenge. In this course, Shawn will show us how to take his design course and implement it in ASP.NET Web API including controllers, routing, dependency injection, versioning, security, hypermedia, REST constraints and caching.

To join us at this course it will be assumed that you have already watched Shawn's course on how to design a RESTful API (http://pluralsight.com/courses/web-api-design).  This course covered how to design a RESTful API while avoiding the dogmatic religion of REST but embracing the best of the pragmatic parts.
results.name: Implementing an API in ASP.NET Web API (Week 2 of 6)

Please View & Nominate Books Here
(in the discussion forum post - Winter 2016 Nominations)

Meeting Agenda: We have reserved the room starting 6:30 pm. You are welcome to attend even if you have not read the book (but be prepared for spoilers! ).  www.ameliasbistro.com

Dues: please remember to bring $1 for dues, so we can maintain the meetup.com site, thank you!


Book Details:
Paperback: 352 pages
Publisher: Vintage; Reprint edition (June 2, 2015)
Language: English
ISBN-10:[masked]
ISBN-13:[masked]

Book Description: (From GoodReads.com)


An audacious, darkly glittering novel set in the eerie days of civilization's collapse, Station Eleven tells the spellbinding story of a Hollywood star, his would-be savior, and a nomadic group of actors roaming the scattered outposts of the Great Lakes region, risking everything for art and humanity.

One snowy night Arthur Leander, a famous actor, has a heart attack onstage during a production of King Lear. Jeevan Chaudhary, a paparazzo-turned-EMT, is in the audience and leaps to his aid. A child actress named Kirsten Raymonde watches in horror as Jeevan performs CPR, pumping Arthur's chest as the curtain drops, but Arthur is dead. That same night, as Jeevan walks home from the theater, a terrible flu begins to spread. Hospitals are flooded and Jeevan and his brother barricade themselves inside an apartment, watching out the window as cars clog the highways, gunshots ring out, and life disintegrates around them.

Fifteen years later, Kirsten is an actress with the Traveling Symphony. Together, this small troupe moves between the settlements of an altered world, performing Shakespeare and music for scattered communities of survivors. Written on their caravan, and tattooed on Kirsten's arm is a line from Star Trek: "Because survival is insufficient." But when they arrive in St. Deborah by the Water, they encounter a violent prophet who digs graves for anyone who dares to leave.

Spanning decades, moving back and forth in time, and vividly depicting life before and after the pandemic, this suspenseful, elegiac novel is rife with beauty. As Arthur falls in and out of love, as Jeevan watches the newscasters say their final good-byes, and as Kirsten finds herself caught in the crosshairs of the prophet, we see the strange twists of fate that connect them all. A novel of art, memory, and ambition, Station Eleven tells a story about the relationships that sustain us, the ephemeral nature of fame, and the beauty of the world as we know it .



Editorial Reviews:


from Amazon.com

An Amazon Best Book of the Month, September 2014: A flight from Russia lands in middle America, its passengers carrying a virus that explodes “like a neutron bomb over the surface of the earth.” In a blink, the world as we know it collapses. “No more ballgames played under floodlights,” Emily St. John Mandel writes in this smart and sober homage to life’s smaller pleasures, brutally erased by an apocalypse. “No more trains running under the surface of cities ... No more cities ... No more Internet ... No more avatars.” Survivors become scavengers, roaming the ravaged landscape or clustering in pocket settlements, some of them welcoming, some dangerous. What’s touching about the world of Station Eleven is its ode to what survived, in particular the music and plays performed for wasteland communities by a roving Shakespeare troupe, the Traveling Symphony, whose members form a wounded family of sorts. The story shifts deftly between the fraught post-apocalyptic world and, twenty years earlier, just before the apocalypse, the death of a famous actor, which has a rippling effect across the decades. It’s heartbreaking to watch the troupe strive for more than mere survival. At once terrible and tender, dark and hopeful, Station Eleven is a tragically beautiful novel that both mourns and mocks the things we cherish. –Neal Thompson  --This text refers to the Hardcover edition.

results.description:
-posted by Melissa F.-


Come join Ann, Melissa and all the friendly, awesome people attending this event for dinner at the Whole Foods in Jericho on the first Monday of every month at 6:30 pm. What a great way to start off the week!

This VLI gathering at the Whole Foods store in Jericho is a casual event. Show up at 6:30, or show up later than 6:30. It's totally fine to drop in when you can. 

The store's food bar is vegan-friendly (vegan items are clearly labeled, ingredients are listed).  You pay by the weight of your food. (A typical total is $10-11.) 

As with all VLI meetups, please bring only vegan fare to the table. 

(Our policy is "at VLI meetups, the food is always vegan, and everyone is treated with kindness." In other words, we expect everyone to enjoy a vegan meal together. Even if you or your guests don't think of yourselves as "vegan.")

We'll be hanging out in the eating area, at least until 9:00 (the store closes at 10). Be aware that as it gets later in the evening, the food bar may run out of the more popular items.

NOTE: Whole Foods offers durable bowls, but not durable utensils. So **remember to bring utensils for yourself** to cut down even more on our trash. You could bring your own water bottle, too.

Hope to see you there!

One last thing: even though this gathering is more casual than other restaurant outings, we still appreciate if you can keep your RSVP up-to-date. That way, we know whom to expect/how many seats to save. Thanks!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us in the dining area.
results.name: VLI Meetup: Dinner at Jericho Whole Foods

results.description:
Hi Everyone
We are postponing our winter squash theme until next December. Instead we will be hosting Sarah Owens, founder of BK17 Bakery, an artisan microbakery specializing in sourdough that serves both NYC and Louisville, KY. Sarah will be in town for the release of her new book, Sourdough: Rustic Recipes for Breads, Sweets, Savories, and More, which is being released on November 3. 


Sarah will give a slide show presentation and then we will have the opportunity to sample some of her sourdough breads.    Learn more about Sarah's story in Edible Brooklyn: How Fermentation Saved One Woman’s Stomach.


Best,

Angela Davis

NYC Ferments Co-organizer

Cookbook author Sarah Owens will explain the nutritional benefits of lactic acid fermentation and introduce the basics of using sourdough as an ingredient in breads, sweets, savories, and more. As she guides listeners through a 45 minute slide lecture, Sarah will discuss how she came to using natural leavening and how the power of sourdough has the potential to improve digestive health. Samples of recipes from her book will be on offer to nibble!

Copies of the beautifully photographed Sourdough: Rustic Recipes for Breads, Sweets, Savories, and More will be available for sale by the author, making an excellent addition to your collection or a special holiday gift for your favorite baker.

SARAH OWENS is a professional horticulturist, former steward of the Cranford Rose Collection at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden, and the founder of BK17 Bakery, an artisan microbakery specializing in sourdough that serves both NYC and Louisville, KY. Sarah's customers receive freshly baked goods delivered through a subscription based on seasonally available ingredients and stone-ground heritage grains. She has been featured in Edible Brooklyn, on Gardenista, and on 66 Square Feet. She has also appeared on The Martha Stewart Show.
results.name: Monthly Meetup at Jimmy's no. 43 -Sourdough Book Event with Sarah Owens

results.description:
The Future of the Ticket

This is our 7th event, and we're thrilled to introduce a global event registration platform, Peatix based in NYC! Expect to learn about:
• Starting up in Japan & the early days of Peatix
• Stories of going global & US event market
• Visions and future of Peatix


Please visit and sign up Peatix before you come! (Optional) 

If you want to learn about cross-cultural business between US-Japanese markets, discover new technology, and meet other enthusiastic technologists, please come and join us at Pivotal Labs! (and hang out afterwards at a bar nearby)


Agenda: 

-6:30pm  Door opens/ Networking 
-7:00pm  Opening Remarks        
-7:15pm   Speaker : Taku Harada - Co-founder & CEO, Peatix 
                 Group Discussion for Peatix Business 
-8:00pm  Announcements & Open Networking

About Peatix 
Peatix is a global event registration platform that provides event organizers with powerful tools to create, promote, manage and sell out events of all sizes. Peatix’s innovative, mobile-centric solution for event management has served over 60,000 events since its inception in May 2011. From concerts to conferences, and everything in between, Peatix empowers organizers while enriching the event experience for attendees through social interactions and event discovery in its mobile applications (iPhone, Android) and mobile website. And thanks to the lowest ticketing fees available, and fully customizable event pages, event organizers can promote, sell tickets, and manage their events with considerable ease.


Speaker 

Taku Harada

Taku founded Peatix together with his former colleagues at Amazon, and has served as its CEO since its inception. Taku also held the position of Representative Director and CEO of YOOX Japan until August 2009. Prior to YOOX, Taku held various positions at Amazon Japan including head of its mobile and online marketing divisions. He also launched the iTunes Music Store in Japan while at Apple in 2005 and led its marketing team. Taku began his career at Sony Music Entertainment's international business affairs division in Japan. He holds a B.A. from Yale University.

A special thanks to Pivotal Labs for providing us a space for our event!

We hope that this event will be a place where Japan & NY people can come collaborate. Looking forward to seeing you all!

Masa, Yu & Toby
results.name: November JPNYC Startups Event- The Future of the Ticket

Mahamudra is a Sanskrit word which means union of bliss and emptiness, the very essence of Buddhist Tantric meditation. It is an imaginative step-by-step spiritual training that guides us toward an experience of unparalleled peace and clarity. From this experience, we gain insight into ultimate truth, and the wisdom to live a meaningful life. These teachings help us to integrate all of our spiritual practices into a unified progression toward lasting happiness.
