results.description:
Please join us Monday Nov. 2nd as we sit down with Architect and Senior Design Manager at Apple David del Villar to find out what it takes to balance creative focus and career trajectory. 

Summary:


From the start of an architect’s academic and professional career, it’s promoted, glorified and encouraged to work for firms with esteemed names. The trajectory of these firms, and the individuals associated with them, are extremely well documented throughout the architecture community often times following similar career paths. David del Villar’s career trajectory however, is nothing short of unique and impressive. Starting as an undergraduate architecture student in Spain, David has moved on from the GSD, Rafael Moneo, and Diane von Furstenberg. Now a Senior Design Manager at Apple, David’s responsibilities include overseeing multiple teams across different trades, foreign and domestic code compliance, contract negotiation of consultants, and working closely with internal executives, operations managers, and real estate teams for projects all over the world. Built-In is pleased to welcome David del Villar and hear his story.

Moderated by Mike Zee, Head of Operations @ Built-In

To Do

ABOUT THE SCREENWRITER: One of the main reasons David Benoit writes, like many of his favorite authors, is to express self reflection in storytelling which in turn projects what it means to be human. The human experience is different from other animals in that we have a conscious and can reflect on our lives. Hopefully, David's self­ reflective stories engage the audience and make them contemplate their own human nature.

results.description:
Beyond Faith is a support group for young people under 30 who are currently, or have in the past, gone through the often difficult process of leaving Christianity. Beyond Faith is for the person who doesn't quite fit in with the pack, a person whose ideals and beliefs do not jive with their peers, family members, or loved ones. This can be a tough journey, especially for those whose family and friends are unsupportive of their doubts and lack of belief. Our group aims to create a safe space of support, community, inclusiveness, and encouragement on this journey away from Christianity and towards a reason-based worldview. For some, just the idea of entertaining serious doubts about faith can be dangerous and overwhelming, and Beyond Faith seeks to ease the process and create a warm, welcoming and optimistic environment for like-minded folks on the same path.


Beyond Faith is open to any young people who identify as atheist, agnostic, Humanist, or who are having doubts about Christianity. We are open to any and all denominations of Christianity. Beyond Faith is a safe space for women, people of color, LGBTQ people, and those who are differently-abled. Because of this, the facilitators and participants of this group will be expected to keep member identities, meeting locations, and content confidential to protect everyone involved.

In order to ensure the confidentiality and safety of our group members, please email [masked] with the following questionnaire for the location details.


New Member Questionnaire:
In an effort to ensure all members of this group are respectful and open to others, we ask that you fill out this short questionnaire so the organizers can tailor the group to its members. We have a zero-tolerance policy for evangelism at our meetings; people attending for the sake of evangelizing will be asked to leave. We do this in an effort to protect our members and ensure that our group is a safe space for all attendees.

This is NOT an application, all serious members will be invited regardless of answers to the questions below.

1. Why are you interested in Beyond Faith?

2. Can you tell us a little about yourself (including name/age/where you're from), and how your experiences have brought you the point you're at now? [You only need to share as much as you are comfortable with]

3. Do you define yourself as any/all of the following: atheist, agnostic, humanist, nontheist, or any other term?

4. Where would you consider yourself on your journey out of Christianity and into atheism/agnosticism/nontheism/etc?

 

Please feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions. You are welcome and encouraged to bring friends and family members that you think may benefit from this group as well. We look forward to having you!

 

As there is limited space, we ask that you only attend if you are under the age of 30. If, however, you are older than 30 and are very interested in attending, or have attended our discussions in the past, please send us a private message and we may be able to work something out.
results.name: Beyond Faith: An Ex-Christian Student Support Group

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

Simon

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

All skill levels are encouraged to attend. Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

75min. This Soccer Workout will help to increase your leg power, core and upper body strength, overall agility as well as mental strength. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
Hope and Faith

Sura 15 Aya 56

And who but those who have gone astray abandon hope of the Lord’s mercy?

All of us can find ourselves in situations where we face daunting obstacles. You or someone you love can be severely ill, your business or career can be in a crisis, or you can be badly hurt by people you love. There are people who have been wrongfully arrested and put in prison for long periods of time. There are women who have been abandoned by their husbands and left with children to raise. You feel like you have fallen into a well and there is no way to climb out.

 This aya teaches that it is a mistake to give up hope. Hope is another word for faith. Hope means believing that from every crisis some good will emerge, and it does for those who keep hope alive under all circumstances.

The nature of hope will be discussed in our meeting, as well as methods for staying hopeful in distressful situations

You are welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the meeting.


Our discussions are based on the book 'The Quran and The Life of Excellence.'

  Notice: The attendees will be requested to contribute $ 5 each to help with the cost of renting the meeting room.
results.name: Quran Discussion in Manhattan-Hope and Faith-Part B

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

The evening will begin promptly at 7:00 pm.

Please be punctual and check-in prior to 7 pm in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Community Circling Practice Night will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6-6:45 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7-10 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month  (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

Join Be Social Change on Monday, November 2nd from 7 PM to 9 PM for Storytelling Fundamentals - Crafting Tales That Captivate Any Audience with Minna Taylor of The Engaging Educator.   

===========================================

LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE! This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: bit.ly/StorytellingNov2

**BSC Unlimited pass holders get a 50% discount on this workshop**

===========================================

Everyone loves a good story. Whether you are teaching a lesson, leading a meeting or presentation, or going on a date, storytelling is an incredible approach to effective communication. But what makes a story stand out, and engage the listener? A dramatic hook, a funny anecdote or a solid button – all can encourage looking, increase understanding and snag the audience.

This workshop uses interactive activities to teach the basics of good storytelling. Students will learn tips and tricks to make their stories fun, engaging, and interesting, and have a chance to workshop the beginnings of story with personalized feedback.

WHAT YOU’LL LEARN

• How to craft a good story

• What elements are necessary for a story to be effective

• Dramatic tips and tricks for making any story interesting and engaging

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Professionals, entrepreneurs, creatives, and communications strategists/marketers looking to work on their storytelling skills

• Professionals who have a story they are looking to polish for presentation

Educators who want to use storytelling in their education plans

INSTRUCTOR BIO

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/zzpCJHNHH4ghMlBYqos4OHGDNDBrGH-zixcQ5EDwZ5CzmlaTnbH916TZpTUr1l33KpuwEOmhZ22lfeV1Y4Uk2TKtnkvupfzQPjH8GtTiXkJrnO7KgfUyxBtrEaSa0hyOtn5-e-OY

Minna Taylor is a NYC based communication coach. Her company, Energizeyourvoice.net, focuses on helping professionals discover their full voice in order to unlock their full potential. She coaches people into presence and rediscovering their authentic self through personalized programs suited to the individual or institution. Her methods are founded in business strategy with a heavy emphasis on play and moment to moment discovery.

Her teaching specialties are public speaking, presentation skills, and team building. She has a BFA from NYU Tish in association with The Atlantic Theater Company and an MFA from Brooklyn College with a concentration in speech and vocal production. She is a working Voice Over artist and comedy film producer.

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Rfn6U1iSX0rBUmM_iBWL1aoK0X1tm8Zwz6legFg_pmrLweSsLWwppPeV97Wu6GbIdj2v86LKgw5C-a5nTEvSsgB6ByvFwU0qxXrPij7QsLUAHoVXt4yAU9gxQA_FA5K5qQfVGa0

Realizing the connection between improvisation and communication, The Engaging Educator (@TheEngagingEd), specializes in customized improv-based education. We provide classes that enhance public speaking, creativity, flexibility, positive risk-taking, teamwork and more by flexing improv muscles. Beyond our classes for educators and professionals, we also specialize in improv for high school students, corporate workshops, and improv for individuals on the autism spectrum, as well as individuals with cerebral palsy.

The Engaging Educator is a passionate and talented team of educators, facilitators and professionals. Each of our Engagers brings a distinct style and energy to our brand of "Yes, And," and all believe in the power of Improv as Continuing Education.

SPACE PARTNER

The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.

What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.

Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.

Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
Join Be Social Change on Monday, November 2nd from 7PM to 9PM for our class on Intro to Facilitation - Fundamentals in Becoming an Effective Facilitator with Kristina Drury, Founder and Creative Director of TYTHEdesign.

===========================================

LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE! This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCFacilitation101Nov2

**BSC Unlimited pass holders get a 50% discount on this workshop**

===========================================

 Are you looking to enhance your leadership skills while infusing your work with more collaboration? Facilitating activities (design thinking based and beyond) with your team or community can lead to more team collaboration, greater team capacity, and productive communication with your community. This intro class answers ‘what is facilitation?’ and will demystify why you facilitate collaboration, your role as a facilitator, when to prepare a facilitated collaborative session and how to build it around your own style.

In addition to introducing the foundational basics of facilitation, we will model a participatory activity to demonstrate tips and tricks to guiding a collaborative experience. Identifying the tools and strategies to maximize working with the various stakeholders involved with your project, program or organization. This class gives an overview of the key tenets to being a strong facilitator, introduces design-based facilitation frameworks, and provides TYTHEdesign's own examples of implementation. Come ready to learn, ask, and engage!


WHAT YOU’LL LEARN 

• The basics of facilitation

• Keys to being a strong facilitator

• Strategies for building your collaboration session

• Activities that demonstrate how to brainstorm in a participatory design process

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Individuals interested in facilitation and relatively new to the role or looking for a refresher of the basics

• Individuals from all professional or educational backgrounds interested in developing their group management and leadership skills

• Managers looking for tools to activate collaboration within their teams

• Professionals who work in community engagement or are about to begin community engagement projects or programs

• Individuals looking to add creative thinking methodology to their work

INSTRUCTOR BIO

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/3aFiMB9DK24Lk63e1fTvsZZNdyDCg9UmgzQRBAyFQNoAHnZsLnLSp_JT5ry1YV-hp1oxqjIDyYE40KSJx2t90kB91ZsJG-YJbhQhDheqaFOJ-fXVvVxYy2E9jzhPin3HRGrDRJ4

Kristina Drury (@TYTHEdesign) founder of TYTHEdesign, is a social entrepreneur, designer and educator. TYTHE, a social impact firm, uses the lens of design and strategy to support organizations build their capacity in the social good community. Under her leadership TYTHE has increased the community impact of over 75 local and global social good organizations including the NYC Dept. of Education, Citi Community Development, Public Policy Lab and California State Library System. Recently, Kristina has been named a UNDP Innovation Expert. Prior to starting TYTHE, Kristina co-led the nonprofit Project H and worked in corporate social responsibility consulting. As an educator she has taught classes, workshops and training to build the capacity of over 600 change-makers, leaders, and entrepreneurs. Her teaching and speaking experience includes engagements at the Clinton Global Initiative University, Cooper-Hewitt Museum and New Museum’s Ideas City Festival.

You can learn about Kristina’s current work here and find out more about her background here.

SPACE PARTNER


The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation


3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work


- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified


(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there,

Dan

347 - 743 - 1854
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Topic: Cross Country Challenge

Speaker: Air Safety Institute Presenter

When we talk about safety, we normally tackle one issue at a time—thunderstorms one day, taxi clearances the next. But out in the real world, any given flight can bring together a whole range of interconnected safety issues:

Fly through that precip…or deviate and cut into my fuel reserve? Climb above that scattered layer…or risk airsick passengers? Fly with an underinflated nose strut…or delay and fly in worse wx?

Our new seminar reflects that reality. You’ll follow along as we “fly” two fictional trips, answering questions (and debating answers) along the way. From preflight planning to tie-down technique, if it’s related to the flight, it’s fair game!

Click here for seminar details and for how to receive Wings credit.

NOTE: There is no online registration for this event.

The Air Safety Institute's safety seminars qualifies toward AOPA Accident Forgiveness and for the safety seminar portion of the FAA WINGS program.

ASI safety seminars are funded by generous donations from the Conrad N. Hilton Foundation and pilots like you.

results.name: AOPA Air Safety Institute Seminar

results.description:
Meditation for Healthy Living

Dr. Andrew Vidich, an educator, author and public speaker, will discuss how meditation improves the physical, mental and spiritual aspects of our health using effective methods. It helps you to create a more satisfying lifestyle including harmonious relationships and a deepened sense of peace. results.description: As part of the Monday night Secret Doctrine study class of ULT (United Lodge of Theosophists), I will be presenting a series of lectures on the Sephirotic Tree of Life. The main emphasis will be to use the Tree of Life as a foundation / emblem in order to better understand the symbols and esoteric teachings in Helena Petrovna Blavatky's grand opus the Secret Doctrine which was published in 1888. Along the way we will explore symbols and teachings of the secret / esoteric wisdom schools of the Tibetan Buddhist, Hindu, Egyptian Hierophants, Gnostics, Pythagoreans, Semites, Alchemists, Rosicrucians, etc.

results.description:
YC Grad - Raven Tech Recruitment @ NYCCEO


Come join us now!  CEO and Founder will be here to share his story and recruit on the spot! Get your tickets now! 

Nov.2nd

7:30pm-9:30pm

424 Broadway, Unit 602, New York

Introduction of the company 

Raven is an extremely intelligent crow and it often shows the strange behavior which other animals cannot understand. In the story of Bible, a raven picked up Jesus’ shroud to bring Jesus back to life and anew era came out.

Founded in May 2014, Raven Tech's mission is to make our lives easier, more elegant and more efficient with the power of technology and design. As one of the fifth batch of graduates from Microsoft Ventures Accelerator, and the only startup from Mainland China enrolled in the Y Combinator W15, Raven Tech raised $3MM for Angel round from ZhenFund and Matrix Partners China, and $15MM from DCM, ZhenFund, Matrix Partners China and YC for Series A round. Now the company has offices in Beijing, China and the Silicon Valley, USA.

Learn more about Raven: 

https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/raven-tech

Founder&CEO

Cheng (Jesse) Lu, founder and CEO of Raven Tech, was born in 1990 in Xi’an Shaanxi Province, and graduated from University of Liverpool, UK. He started his business while he was still in university. Jesse is one of the "2015 Forbes 30Under 30: Entrepreneurs”.

渡鸦科技创始人兼 CEO，吕骋， 1990年出生于陕西西安，毕业于英国利物浦大学，大学期间开始创业，福布斯 2015 年 30岁以下 30 位创业者之一。

Our product

RavenTech is focusing on the next generation of human-machine and human-human interaction system, which is called Project Flow. Music Flow, a pure simple music player, is the music feature of Project Flow. Although MusicFlow came out by accident, it leads a new fashion of design and interaction for music players.  

Flow,is the way users interact with mobile phones and intelligent terminals in the future, meaning taking off all the covers and shells of Apps. With the shell free architecture, innovative Project Flow will bring up a direct answer to the commands, rather than activating an App.

About the recruitment

Core members of Raven Tech including Jesse Lu is having a road trip across the nation, from SF to NYC and visit 12top universities seeking for talents. We are eager for geniuses and artists to join us. Everyone may identify themselves as crazy ones, yet few will be respected. And you, might be one of the ravens making the ridiculous dreams real. We are Raven Tech, the missionaries of the new era.

包括吕骋在内的核心团队成员将从旧金山一路开车前往纽约，拜访12所顶尖高校，只为找到向往的人。我们希望天才和艺术家们加入我们的团队。每个人都会把自己视为为生命痴狂的人，然而只有少数人实现了他们的价值。幸运的你，将有机会成为一只实现梦想的渡鸦。

Positions / 招聘职位

自然语言处理（NLP）工程师/ NLP Engineer


Android 工程师/ Android Engineer

iOS 工程师/ iOS Engineer

研发工程师（IM 方向）/ R&D Engineer (IM Focus)

PHP 工程师/ PHP Engineer

Node 工程师/ Node.js Engineer

Web 前端工程师/ Web Developer

移动端 UI 设计师/ App UI Designer

Web 端 UI 设计师/ Web UI Designer

美国技术负责人（项目经理）/ U.S. Project Manager

硅谷办公室运营 / U.S. Operation Manager

Unless noted specifically, you can chose the working location, either in Beijing or in Menlo Park, and working visa will be sponsored.

Please feel free to send your resume and cover letter to [masked].

NYCCEO - 纽约华人创业家协会：


NYCCEO于2012年在Meetup社交网站上发起并快速成长为纽约最具影响力的创业服务组织之一，是连接美国东西岸和中国创业圈的桥梁，宗旨是力求为创业公司寻求优秀人才，为创业项目寻求投资资金，为各种合作寻求对接信息和合作伙伴。我们每个月会定期举办各种形式的创业主题活动。自创立以来一直与中美顶尖的创投和科技公司合办活动，活动嘉宾代表机构包括顺为资本，IDG，真格基金，小米，Amazon,Google，jet.com，中国联通，长城会等。NYCCEO现有超过1,500名来自纽约金融，IT，科技，时尚，设计等各领域的优秀人才。

联系NYCCEO请扫群二维码

results.description:
I was born with internal properties which I have not chosen. Then, the environment, my family and the education I received operated on me from the outside and built me in a certain way. And thus I live, as a result of these two conditions, which I have not defined. 

All of a sudden a question awakens in me: “Why am I alive? What for? ” I didn’t choose this question either, it simply awakened from within me. This is the beginning of the awakening of the “point in the heart” and it pulls me to a higher world. Here, the possibility of choice begins.” - Dr. Michael Laitman. 

Join us for a casual evening of discussions, Q&A, and lively workshops with other like minded seekers guided by experienced Kabbalah teachers. We’ll watch thought provoking clips over coffee and treats as we learn about the basic principles of the Wisdom of Kabbalah as taught by Bnei Baruch.

We are introducing a new Kab Night location in QUEENS in addition to the ones in Manhattan! 

Address: 

98-80 Queens Blvd, Suite LL2
Rego Park, NY 11374
results.name: Kab Night Queens: The Path to Spiritual Development

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014
--------------------------------------------------------------------


Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation Energize your body Strenthen your mind Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 7:30 PM – 9:00 PM Day: Mondays Where: Room #102, Freeport Recreation Center 130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520 Contact: Nan, [masked],[masked]

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card. The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.
results.name: Bodhi Meditation - Freeport Long Island (FREE**)

It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

 -------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

One of our members, Mercedes, has a free, live R&B and Jazz set at one of Harlem's newer restaurants, Harlem Besame  (Harlem Besame Facebook Page). Let's meetup and show her some support and check out a new spot in the process! The flyer for her event is below.

Our Meetup

We'll meet at Harlem Besame at 7:45pm, where there will be an area reserved for the group to check out the music which starts at 8pm. Wait service will be available to order food and drinks from the menu. If you have any questions or can't find the group, feel free to call or text Daniel at 774.275.3646. 

Directions to Harlem Besame

Take the #2 or #3 trains to 125th Street and walk avenue west to 125th street and Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Blvd. The restaurant is on 124th street & ACP Jr Blvd. The A, B, C, or D trains are also nearby and the M2 bus also san alternative. 

Public street parking should be available near the restaurant and a parking garage is located on 124th street between Lenox Avenue and ACP Jr. Blvd.

Great dinner and dancing experience, live music, performers and guest DJ's. 

• RSVP: To enjoy the reduced admission , Mention the code that you will see in the comment section, it is different every week !!

• What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

Dancing is so much fun, I really feel alive when I am dancing Salsa! It's Friday night, you should go out and have some fun! Go out and meet some new friends!

Please join us for another FREE Salsa dance party, a 2 hours fun networking event with 2 hours of non-stop Salsa music and dancing 

Dancing non-stop is a lot of fun.

Salsa dancing for more than 2 hours is a really fun way to exercise and burn off all the calories. Dancing is a good workout, it may "improve your health and give you more energy". We will rotate dance partners every five minutes, so that each person will make many new friends during this fun networking event.

Name tags will be handed out to each guest during the start of the event for the open space networking session.

The best and really nice Salsa music will be playing on the high quality BOSE sound system, over the last 5 years we have created a collection of 1000 Salsa songs.


Friends from 12 networking groups will be attending this event.

James

results.description:
Join our Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble in time to perform a great Holiday show in December!
We’ll be playing Christmas classics “Merry Christmas, Baby”, “Please come home for Christmas”, “JIngle Bell Rock” and more!
We’ll have 10 practices and then perform on Sunday, December 13th at Arlene’s Grocery at 3pm. SHOW

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Our show will be at 3pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in November) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

CALENDAR

Our practice schedule starts Thursday 6-8pm on October 1st.

It is important that you attend to as many as you can if you plan on performing, a required 7 session minimum will be necessary to perform and VERY IMPORTANT that you come to the last 2 practices which will be with a drummer and a singer

results.description:
Take a a chance and learn something new. Come to our Argentine Tango for Beginners classes and see what all the passionate fuss is all about.  If you learn the right way from the start, you will not develop any bad habits.  Mayte will take you through the concepts, steps and techniques able to get you moving quickly on the dance floor so you can start being a part of the beautiful social dance scene in New York City, Westchester and surrounding areas. 

Come enjoy the pleasure of live music, great performances, wonderful friends and the joy of moving to the music in a warm embrace. If you've already learned other dances, come and improve your sense of balance, elegance, leading and following while taking on this Argentine wonder and discovering a new way to move and express yourself.

We'll look forward to seeing you there.

results.description:

Power yoga builds core strength, builds muscle, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and meditation after class.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

results.description:
Dancing is so much fun, I really feel alive when I am dancing Salsa! It's Friday night, you should go out and have some fun! Go out and meet some new friends! 

Please join us for another FREE Salsa dance party, a 2 hours fun networking event with 2 hours of non-stop Salsa music and dancing 

Dancing non-stop is a lot of fun.

Salsa dancing for more than 2 hours is a really fun way to exercise and burn off all the calories. Dancing is a good workout, it may "improve your health and give you more energy". We will rotate dance partners every five minutes, so that each person will make many new friends during this fun networking event.

Name tags will be handed out to each guest during the start of the event for the open space networking session.

The best and really nice Salsa music will be playing on the high quality BOSE sound system, over the last 5 years we have created a collection of 1000 Salsa songs.

Friends from 12 networking groups will be attending this event. 

Business Owners may apply for a free Vendor Table to promote their business during this event for free.Each vendor is required to give out some type of free gifts to our attending guests. Bring your own small size portable vendor table. Contact James, the Event Organizer to make your free promotions appointment. 

14,000 people are reading this message and only 35 tickets are available. Please RSVP now.

Thank You.

James

Baladi Beat Belly Dance resumes its weekly dance class in Jersey City with Tarik Sultan.

In this class you will learn how to dance like a natural and unlock your inner beauty! You will learn how to respond to the music in a way that allows you to express your emotions through movement. Other added benifits: Increase your muscle tone, stamina, coordination, posture. Releive stress and tension all while have fun and looking great!

All classes begin with a warm up consisting of the core movements, allowing you to develope your skills at your own pace. Wonderful friendly, accepting atmosphere, lots of encouragement and feedback! At Baladi Beat, you are never just another face in the crowd, but an individual!

Classes start this Monday 8:00pm to 9:00pm

$20 a single class, $45 for 3 classes, $60 for 4.

results.description:
Monday, 11/2 from 8 – 9:30 pm with  Chris Pelham

Reading assignment: ACIM Textbook ch. 16, section 7

A Course in Miracles and A Course of Love classes are $20 each

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.

These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
Healing Clinic suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!

results.description:
Guys, This meetup is to talk about the issues we each face. Some of the things that cause a lot of trouble: Problems with the ex. Harm to the children, and how to reduce it. If you have visitation and not custody, there are visitation problems we all deal with. Everyone pays child support. My idea is to kick around our problems and experiences, and see if that helps in dealing with the issues. I have changed the location for the meetup: at TGI Fridays 826 New Jersey 3 Clifton. This is a pretty nice TGI Fridays, and it is easy to get to.

Please come on time, and bring a friend with you. And please be ready to listen as well as ask questions.  This is a bunch of us who have been through it.  It is a good group!

see you then,

Bob Davies

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
Hey Guys,

The 5v5 Indoor Co-Ed is back! Matches start Nov 19th at one of the best gyms in Brooklyn, 5 mins walk from Atlantic Terminal subway.


The 10% early bird offer is extended to Nov 2nd! Details and Registration at:


http://www.group-stage.com/futsal-5-a-side/


Located at one of the best gyms in Brooklyn! We use Futsal rules, i.e, a heavier ball and walls are not in play. All players receive team jerseys and post game drink specials at a local bar. It's a 7 min walk from Atlantic Center subway, or 4 min from C train subway.


DETAILS:

• Teams are 5v5, max roster 10 players


• 8 game minimum


•  45min matches, unlimited subs

• Players receive GSF T-shirt


•  Finalists awarded medals

•  1 female player required during matches


•  Drinks specials at a local bar

REGISTRATION:

results.description:
ELECTION DAY - This is it folks, do or die for your Town and County Elections!

Today is the day we have all been working so hard to get to...now we need to make sure we get out the vote. 

This year we are voting on local elections - Town and County elections and several Judicial positions. There are a few special elections this year, several Assembly Districts and NYC Council position.  

Poll Hours:   All polls close at 9:00 pm. 
Polls open at 6:00 am in the counties of Nassau, Suffolk, Westchester, Rockland, Orange, Putnam and Erie and in New York City.  In all other counties, polls open at 12:00 noon. 

Where to vote:   Not sure where you go to vote?  Then use this link to find your local polling place. This is valid for all NYS residents! 
https://voterlookup.elections.state.ny.us/votersearch.aspx

It is UP TO US! 

It is UP TO US to make sure we get our friends and neighbors out to vote. 

It is UP TO US to make sure everyone hears about those candidates who will bring logic to NYS and bring our values into office. 

None of us want to wake up on November 4th and say 'what if I did more?
It will be too late.  

So please do all you can, every little bit helps!

Thank you. 

WE WILL NOT COMPLY

Stephen Flanagan 
Founder, Executive Director 
Conservative Society for Action
results.name: Election Day - Your Vote is your Voice!

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
***Please note: This event requires registration. To purchase tickets visit our eZ Conference Eventbrite Page. ***

Members of the New York eZ Publish Community will receive 15% discount by using promo code: ezmeetupnyc 


For more information about the eZ Content Technology Conference visit the conference website. For the latest conference updates visit the eZ Blog.

-------------------------------------------------------------

About the Conference

The eZ Content Technology Conference is an annual conference where ideas are exchanged, connections are made, and business accomplishments are recognized.

eZ Conference will bring together the largest gathering of members from the eZ community from around the world - from those who use eZ Publish, eZ Publish Platform or forthcoming eZ Platform and Studio, to the developers and designers creating online experiences.

This year marks a special occasion for the conference for two reasons. It will be the first time the conference is hosted outside of Europe, taking place this year in New York City. It will also be time to celebrate the fall release of eZ Platform and eZ Studio, as we discuss the many possibilities for the future platform.

So join us for a week of celebration, talks, learning, networking and awards as we grow our community and conference into the future.

eZ Conference will be held on November 3rd through 5th at the Wythe Hotel in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Located a short subway ride from downtown Manhattan. 

At the eZ Conference You Will

- Learn the latest - and upcoming - improvements to eZ Platform and eZ Studio

- Network with the innovators in the Web, Digital Marketing, Symfony, PHP and eZ communities

- Expand your knowledge through speakers and workshops and be introduced to new ideas and strategies -there is really something for everyone! 

What Topics will the eZ Conference Cover?

- eZ Platform & eZ Studio Development - Business and Strategy
- Symfony & PHP
- Web Development
- Front End Development
- User Experience (UX) and User Interface (UI) Design 

Guest Speakers Include: 


- Paul Boag - Consultant, Author and Speaker

- Karen McGrane - Author and Speaker

- Deane Barker - Chief Strategy Offices at Blend Interactive

- Bernahard Schussek - Core Developer at Symfony 

- Subrata Mukherjee - VP of Product Management at Economist Digital

- Plus talks from Hootsuite, Connective DX, Blackfire.io, MogoDB, Novactive and many more. View the full list of speakers here.
results.name: eZ Content Technology Conference & Awards

results.description:
NYC Uncubed is an innovation conference and career-focused tech circus unlike anything you've ever been to before. 

Featuring interactive company showcases, product demos, classes on cutting-edge skills & techniques, drinks, music, & live art showcases. 

-- WHY LIVE ART? ---

We have art friends. We have tech friends. The two circles don't interact as much as they should! Tech startups typically develop their products using a methodology where they build as fast as they can and then show the result to people for immediate feedback. We thought it would be interesting for artists to do the same thing on canvas during the event. 

-- INTERESTED IN BEING A LIVE ARTIST @ NYC UNCUBED? -- 

We work with RAW artists to put on live art show, but we are also seeking submissions for independent artists! If you're interested in applying to be a live art participant at this Fall's NYC Uncubed (Tuesday, Nov 3), please send along a link to perry[at]uncubed.com with your online portfolio & you'll be notified.

results.description:
The Archetype of the Designer: It's Emergence in Our Time

Speaker: David Walczyk, EdD.

"We are not what happened to us,
  we are what we wish to become." - C.G. Jung

Ever since the first tools were created over 3 million years ago, humans and their ancestors have been designing. Yet, throughout human history, the archetype of the designer has been activated through the few, while remaining embryonic and in potentia for the many. Change is in the air. At this moment, in our time, the archetype of the designer is being activated throughout the world, through anyone who chooses to relate to it.

Let us then consider the following: What is the archetype of the designer? How is it shifting contemporarily? Why is it emerging so vigorously now?

David Walczyk, EdD, is the founder of The Center for Design + Consciousness and is in training at the C.G. Jung Institute of New York. An award winning designer for over 20 years, he has also served as a Visiting Scholar at the United States Library of Congress, a Policy Fellow at the United States National Academy of Sciences, and was a co-author of the evaluation criteria for the Buckminster Fuller Challenge, named socially responsible design's highest award. Visit davidwalczyk.com.

results.description:
I give a 'free', forever ongoing, astronomy class at the Senior Center.  You don't have to be a senior to join, but you must join the Senior Center for $72/year, which you can defer for at least a month, until you determine that you want to continue.

I never give the same lecture twice.  It would bore me.  My lectures are well prepared, and contain enormous resources from the live web, projected from my laptop to a flat screen TV.  It's all about gaining a perspective of your/my place in the universe.

==================

The class meets Tuesdays at 12:45pm.  Just come.  241 W 72st.  Ask for Laird.  (As of August, 2014, as well as for the last 5 years.)

To make sure the class isn't cancelled (it normally meets every week of the year), please email me at laird wh (one word) at aol dot com.  Make sure the word MEETUP does NOT appear anywhere in the email.  (It gets sorted away from my inbox.)
results.why: Astronomy is about EVERYTHING.  Or at least thats why I became interested in it in 2nd grade.  Now, 40 years post Ph.D. in Astronomy, Astronomy, and indeed all of science is still my passion.   My advisor was Carl Sagan.
results.how_to_find_us: Email me at laird wh (one word) at aol dot com.  Make sure the word MEETUP does NOT appear anywhere in your email.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Description:

Research increasingly shows (“Young Adults with Autism Can Thrive in High-Tech Jobs” by Lauren Silverman, NPR, April 22, 2013) that adults on the autism spectrum can succeed in a wide range of jobs, provided they have the necessary tech skills and can qualify for jobs that are well adapted to their individual needs.  Technology jobs are particularly suited to many on the autism spectrum, and yet there are few training programs for students geared to this population. Tech Kids Unlimited is a not-for-profit program which is teaching kids on the autism spectrum 21st century tech tools so they can become the next generation of makers and producers.

Bio:

Beth Rosenberg is an educator who works with teachers, students, technologists, academics, parents, families and schools. She has worked on curriculum, strategic development, program outreach, interpretive educational exhibition materials, partnerships and collaborations between cultural organizations, community organizations and schools.  Beth held education staff positions at Eyebeam Center for Art and Technology in NYC where she was the Founding Education Director and The Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum where she was the Education Program Manager for many years. She holds a BA and an MA in Art History and an MS in Educational Technology. Beth is on the faculty at the Brooklyn Experimental Media Center at NYU-Polytechnic Institute in Brooklyn, NY.  A parent of a teen on the spectrum, she is an advocate for students with disabilities and is the Founder/Director of TechKidsUnlimited.org, a technology not-for-profit program for special needs youth.

results.description:
Heard about Docker? Want to know what it is exactly? But you're worried it's too complicated? at HH4 you learn to create a Docker container, pull an existing container from the Docker community hub, push your new container to your own Docker repository, and deploy your container to the cloud.

Requirement: 

The recommended way (that I will use in the workshop) is described in the workshop tutorial, see here:

https://ibm.box.com/shared/static/pxlms8upxzo44a4gqnyegtxkpcpkubxn.pdf

Signup for Bluemix:

</a><a href="https://ibm.biz/bluemixnyc">https://ibm.biz/bluemixnyc

Install VirtualBox:


https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads 

Download the workshop image with Docker, CF, CI pre-installed:

https://ibm.box.com/s/5vowq9c289bfi9il01ghzysbswdgqt3l


Join Hack Hours at our WeWork Lounge, with a technical demo, then follow the workshop step by step, or code on your own, technical help is always present on site. (Bring your own laptop)


AGENDA

6.00 sit down, have a drink, chat, relax, forget you're in NYC


6.30 today's topic: Docker for absolute beginners, intro and demo


7.00 after the demo, you can do the workshop step by step, ask for help if needed, or work on your own cloud project


9.00 wrapping up


At the end of the evening you should have created your first Docker container, pushed it to the registry, deployed your own Docker container to the cloud, be able to pull and deploy a container from the Docker hub, and who knows what more.


Hosted @WeWork, with FREE FOOD AND DRINKS.

PS. Join our new Free Bootcamp NYC page on Facebook to share your suggestions for new topics, photos, ideas and other tech stuff.


https://www.facebook.com/freebootcampnyc
results.name: Bluemix Hack Hours 4 (w/ Docker for absolute beginners workshop)

results.description:
Hello HTFers,

We welcome everyone to join us for a series of pitches by some innovative healthcare start-ups in NYC. You'll get to see firsthand how these startups are providing innovative solutions to problems that we face today while better understanding how startups work. Not only that, but you'll be able to give your feedback on the product. 

We'll have food and beverages along with plenty of time to meet and greet with everyone at the event. Here's the schedule:

6 pm - 7 pm - Check-In and networking

7 pm - 8 pm - Pitch Event

8 pm - 9 pm - More networking and wrapping up the evening.

Companies Participating in the Event:

Iris Interactive (Speaker: Janaki Joshi)

Iris Interactive is a leading provider of innovative cloud based collaboration platform for managing Innovation, Product Commercialization and Execution Excellence. The Iris Interactive platform provides real time visibility for senior management, efficiency for the teams and velocity for the organization. Iris for Life Sciences is purpose built for managing a brand/asset from Proof of Concept all the way to Loss of Exclusivity.

1DocWay (Speaker: Samir Malik)

1DocWay enables psychiatrists to interact face-to-face with patients in clinics in remote and rural settings, such as hospitals, primary care offices and nursing homes. 1DocWay has served over 25,000 patients to date in 11 states via telepsychiatry, helping providers expand their reach of services into underserved care facilities to increase access to psychiatrists and improve community health; and reduces the high cost of comorbid patients suffering both chronic and mental illnesses.

Ribbit.me (Speaker: Gregory Simon)

Ribbit.me’s LoyaltyNetwork for the first time ever is bringing instant gratification to healthy behavior. People are rewarded real-time for incentivized behavior, reducing health care costs and making them wealthier, healthier, happier.

RepDoc (Speaker: Jason Maier)

RepDoc allows doctors to schedule sales representative meetings online, so then can get product information when they need it, to better treat their patients.

Wellth (Speaker: Alec Zopf)

Wellth's mobile app helps chronic disease patients stay motivated by connecting financial rewards to their daily care plans.  Insurance companies and provider systems foot the bill, and everyone benefits as patients avoid costly adverse health events.

Smart Vision Labs (Speaker: Vickram Jain)

Smart Vision Labs was founded to bring vision to everyone. 500 million people around the globe suffer from vision loss due to uncorrected refractive errors. The SVOne is an ultraportable autorefractor powered by cutting-edge technology. Our smartphone-based platform enables you to perform simple, accurate, and fast refractions. 

Roundtable Judge:


Mark Putyanita, Image Reading Center

Come ready to give feedback to these companies. Your opinions could help make their products more user friendly down the road! 

Thank you to our sponsor, Troutman Sanders, for graciously hosting us! 

Looking forward to seeing everyone at the event. The address information is below:

Troutman Sanders

875 3rd Avenue 

New York, NY 10022


17th Floor

Best,

NYC HTF Team
results.name: Healthcare Start-Up Roundtable

results.description:
Welcome to Drupal NYC!


Our November meetup will feature Howard Tyson, VP of Engineering at Zivtech. He will be speaking about Probo.ci, a new open source continuous integration system designed from the ground up to work with Drupal.

Please note that this meetup will be on the first Tuesday of November, not Wednesday. You must enter your real name on the RSVP question or your RSVP will be removed. Check-in opens at 6pm sharp, see you on the 3rd!


Agenda
• 6:00 - Check-in opens, socializing + pizza
• 6:30 - Announcements
• 6:45 - Who's hiring, who's looking?
• 6:50 - Talks begin!
• 8:20 - Closing Remarks, socializing + leftover pizza
• 8:45 - Afterparty @ Bill’s Bar & Burger, concourse bar (1 block north, 16 W. 51st St., accessible via Rockefeller Concourse) https://goo.gl/maps/Eghs2

Talks & Speakers

==========

Introducing Probo.ci by Howard Tyson

Probo.CI is a new open source continuous integration system designed from the ground up to work with Drupal. It integrates with Githhub to build your pull requests and post the status of your builds back to the Github PR, just like travis.ci. The part that is different from travis.ci is that it does not tear down your environment at the end and instead posts a link to that environment on the github issue for easy code review, client feedback, and project manager evaluation. Learn more at http://probo.ci/</a>

Bio:
Howard Tyson is the VP of Engineering at Zivtech where he architects systems using open source components. He has been focused on automation and a devopsy workflow since before devops was a buzz word and has been working in open source since getting a start with Drupal 4.7. He worked on the team that upgraded Drupal.org from CVS to git and has a passion for building tools that make developers lives and jobs easier and more fun.<a href="https://twitter.com/tizzo"> @tizzo

==========

The Physical Web by Elijah Lynn 

The Physical Web is an approach to unleash the core superpower of the web: interaction on demand. People should be able to walk up to any smart device - a vending machine, a poster, a toy, a bus stop, a rental car - and not have to download an app first. Everything should be just a tap away. Learn more at https://google.github.io/physical-web


Bio:
Elijah Lynn (+ElijahLynn) is a senior software engineer at NBCUniversal. Elijah works on the Publisher team where he helps maintain an internal Drupal 7 distribution for brands such as Bravo, USA, Syfy, NBC, Sprout, Oxygen and more. Elijah is an active contributor to Drupal.org and is the maintainer of the Sticky Edit Actions module.

As a former locksmith Elijah once opened a house for the FBI in an emergency situation (they claimed their locksmith couldn't make it), after a few minutes one of the agents joked "come on, the guys on CSI only take 30 seconds"... a few minutes later the lock was opened successfully.


==========

Monitoring Drupal installations by Lumturio
with Murielle Marie Ungricht and Sam Hermans

Drupal is a powerful CMS, frequently used by enterprise clients, but as an open source platform, it is vulnerable to cyber attacks. Security depends on timely updates and monitoring and even though the stakes for enterprise are high, the necessary maintenance is often overlooked, exposing you and your clients to security breaches. We’ll discuss the context of Drupal security today, common mistakes and oversights when implementing Drupal, easy steps that enterprises can take today in order to reduce risks and give a demo of the Lumturio platform.


Bios:

Murielle Marie Ungricht, CEO

Belgium born co-founder Murielle Marie Ungricht is a successful and soulful entrepreneur, mentor, coach, writer and business strategist. She has a heart for women causes and women empowerment. Together with Sam, she has been running her own web agency for more than a decade. After finishing a philosophy major at the Catholic University of Leuven, Belgium she found her way in the corporate world, working as a web project manager for national and international companies.Her latest consultancy position was with the European Union.


Sam Hermans, CTO

Belgium born co-founder Sam Hermans is a successful entrepreneur, technical specialist and developer for one of the largest and fastest growing CMS platforms. He has been running his own web agency with Murielle Marie Ungricht for more than a decade and has been a technical and security consultant for national and international corporations. His latest consultancy position was as the Head of Web Department, working for the European Commission. The European Commission handles over 300M page views per month.


Lumturio is derived from the Esperanto word for Lighthouse. With an expanding and global world in mind, and a future in which cyber security will be of the most critical importance, we find that this name represents our values and vision perfectly.

==========

Want to present at Drupal NYC?!
We are always looking for new talks and speakers from all skill levels. If you are interested in presenting at Drupal NYC please message Ben Jeavons, our Speaker Organizer, @ http://www.meetup.com/drupalnyc/members/6722489
results.how_to_find_us: Enter of 50th street entrance under the neon sign that says Rainbow Room/Observatory Deck. Then go straight and slightly to the right to the check-in table. Here is a video => http://bit.ly/drupalnyc30rockcheckin
results.name: Drupal NYC Meetup @ 30 Rock - November 3rd

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening 5K walk or run or C25K. Because we are meeting after most are getting out of work the pace will be more conversational.

There will be no bag check. If you need to check a bag please go to the Running Company Store located on the second floor of the Time Warner Center located in Columbus Circle, if you are meeting at the Central Park Entrance at Columbus Circle. If you are meeting at the 72nd Street Transverse (72nd Street inside the park, go to Jack Rabbit located at 140 W 72nd St. Bring a lock for your locker. Please indicate in your RSVP where you are meeting.

As with all of our workouts we will include ab and other workouts as well as stretches to enhance your performance.

Walkers and Runners will start out together. We will establish a point to meet up for workouts mid-way. The course we trek will depend on the interest and experience levels of all who join.

Please bring water with you to stay hydrated. We will provide Gevalia Kaffe Iced Coffee with Almond Milk after the work out courtesy of our sponsor.

If you are running late or need to cancel please contact an organizer as soon as possible. 3 no shows will lead to members being pulled out of the group.

If you have any questions please let us know.

We look forward to seeing you all!

Cheers to happy walks and runs!

Your sole sisters,
@JKORunning

The product must not have been made by a third party.

It is advised that all inventors, makers, and entrepreneurs that will be attending bring more than one product in order to give to a social media influencer or blogger.
