results.description:
This is a special event geared for startups, makers, designers, and inventors to showcase products made their own products to other attendees at the event.  While also being able to have it broadcasted and streamed via Periscope.  A great way to get publicity and a great way for video content creators to film content about futuristic products that might change the world.

This will be an exhibition on innovation in two different sectors.  The second floor will be for creative products (example:  fashion, wearables, crafts, original or handmade disposable goods) and the 4th floor for functional (example:  emerging tech, Virtual Reality/Augmented reality, gadgets, wearables, drones,)

Floor 2:

This will be for makers and designers of fashion and craftsman type products to exhibit.  Everything will be products not on the mass market and will not be mass produced or manufactured products.

Floor 4:

Makers of gadgets, drones, wearables, IoT devices, VR/AR products, 3D printers, and other emerging tech makers/inventors/entrepreneurs will be able to show and tell their products to other people.  It is advised that all inventors, makers, and entrepreneurs that will be attending bring more than one product in order to give to a social media influencer or blogger.

Note, everyone who attends with a product of their own gets in for free.  If you are coming with a third party product there will be a $15 fee.  Third party products MUST NOT be on the mass market (example: Apple Watch is innovative but on the mass market and will not qualify).  

Social media influencers and members of the press are allowed to attend by invite only.  If you believe you are a social media influencer or write for a top blog or magazine please email me.

Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/show-and-tell-makers-inventors-entrepreneurs-the-press-and-social-media-influencers-tickets-18624053044

results.description:
Join us on November 3rd for two phenomenal talks.

One of the most exciting announcements to come out of re:Invent this year was the release of the AWS IoT Services. Rather than doing a broad re:Invent recap as we sometimes have in the past, we will be joined by Richard Threlkeld, an Solutions Architect from Amazon, to present and demo the capabilities of their new services. Following the IoT talk we will hear from Simulmedia who has accumulated a significant amount of leanings from the development of their ETL pipelines and Redshift based Datawarehouse. If you are interested in the Big Data space, don't miss this opportunity to benefit from their experience. For more on the sessions see below:


AWS IoT Services

We will have a brief overview of the AWS IoT service and a demo using industry hardware. This scenario will leverage the Shadow functionality of AWS IoT and invoke automated processes based upon the built-in rules engine. Additionally we'll also dive into some of the finer service details such as MQTT, Pub/Sub architecture and security controls.


Building a Data Warehouse in AWS

Hear from Simulmedia's Data Engineering team about how they built out their Data Warehouse using AWS services like Redshift, S3 and EC2. This will be a deep dive into the stack that supports one of the largest collections of TV viewing data in the world. In addition to this, the data team will also explain two of their guiding principles that have made their lives much easier - immutability in ETL pipelines and maintaining state within the Data Warehouse.


Logistics


Food and beverages will be served. Doors open at 6 PM and the program will begin at 6:30.

A special thanks to Simulmedia's for hosting this event! Simulmedia, Inc., a New York based marketing technology company founded in 2009, is the leader in driving guaranteed business outcomes for advertisers through traditional TV marketing. Simulmedia’s VAMOS platform is powered by the world’s largest database of information on what people watch and buy, combined with access to TV inventory that reaches 95% of U.S. TV households. Using its proprietary science and software, Simulmedia reaches specifically-defined audience segments on TV at massive scale, matches consumer purchase data to TV viewing data, and determines the actual sales impact of the advertiser’s TV campaign. The results Simulmedia delivers are guaranteed. For more information, go to www.simulmedia.com or contact [masked].
results.name: IoT & ETL Pipelines

results.description:
*Originally posted in the Symfony PHP NYC Meetup Board*

Join members of the Symfony, PHP and eZ Publish community in Williamsburg, Brooklyn for an evening of networking and discussion. We will kick off the meetup with two great talks from two big Symfony users and contributors!

• André Romcke - "Perfect" caching with FOSHttpCache

At eZ we have been lucky to work with so many talented developers in the PHP and Symfony community, and one of the many projects we have so far contributed to and also benefitted from is FOSHttpCache. A super charged Http Cache implementation with tagging of content, varying of cache by user cache, support for Varnish, Symfony Proxy and Nginx, and much more. But it can still be improved, multi tagging support for Symfony Proxy, and Stale cache handling on purges by tags are two currently missing features for handling all possible high load situations while also being easy to use. Talk builds upon previous talk: Going crazy with HTTP caching - SymfonyLive Paris 2015

• Bernhard Schussek (the guy behind Symfony Forms, yes!) - Puli: PHP's Next Package Revolution Puli is a new PHP technology for building universal packages that can easily be plugged into any project. These packages use and discover each other automatically, without additional configuration.

In your enterprise projects, you can use Puli to build powerful plugin systems. But Puli's consequences are far greater: By unifying "bundles", "modules" and "extensions" of different frameworks, Puli has the potential to radically change the PHP community...

If anyone else want to bring a topic, please feel free to suggest in the comment below. We could have room for a 3rd talk. If not, we suggest to end the day with some social time in one of the many sweet spots around the Wythe hotel around a beer, eventually from the Brooklyn Brewery across the street.

After the meetup we will head over to Brooklyn Bowl for networking, food and drinks.

Looking forward to seeing you all there!
results.name: Symfony, PHP & eZ Publish Meetup Event

***We will be meeting at a new location, the North Academic Center of CCNY***

This is a peer-supported workshop where we get together to share current challenges and approaches to solving problems or just work alongside like-minded individuals and learn through osmosis.


This event is NOT a lecture-style meeting. The agenda is generally set when someone posses a question, so bring questions!


Some topics of discussion are:
-Install/configuration assistance/ (possibly a "getting started" guide)
-Documentation/Standards/"Best Practices"
-Current events/Conventions
-Release testing/bug reporting
-Other projects (Pi/Arduino/Analog devices)


You may also find someone willing to debate VI vs Emacs (however don't expect a conclusion to it ! )


A laptop is not required but strongly recommended.

(If you are working a problem , some log/debugging information will be required)


Bring a project, topic or questions and work with other enthusiasts on using Linux or get assistance with your own Linux/Open Source projects.
(Geeks are more sociable solving problems rather then just talking about themselves )

The coordinators can also provide pointers based on their experience on how to get up and running as well as documentation and other resources for new users.
results.how_to_find_us: Enter the North Academic Center and ask security where NAC 5/110 is. You'll need to show ID. (The 137 st. City College stop on the 1 and the 145th stop on B/D)

results.description:
This week I am going to see Rock the Kasbah I will arrive at 6:30 for the 7:05 pm showing. I  have seat D6 If you are coming post your seat #  Also if anyone wants to we can go to the  Red Oak Diner after the show for snack, just meet in the lobby after to discuss.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie

Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Fri/Sat) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to drive there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!!    Love, Cassie

PS: I am doing this with my friendship group too so if you are S&L do wear your wristbands. If you need to buy one let me know, they are just $1 These are loads of fun at the movies though they glow in the dark!

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!
results.how_to_find_us: assinged seats

results.description:
MBrace is an open source library for the .NET framework that lets you easily declare scalable and extensible distributed computations. Dubbed "Async for the Cloud", the core programming model uses F# computation expressions for composing and distributing code and data. Its client-side integration enables instant deployment of scalable computations directly from F# interactive in Visual Studio.

In this talk I will giving an introduction and overview of MBrace and its programming model. I will also be discussing the project itself, its architecture and future development directions. Join us to learn how can use MBrace to target your own cloud infrastructure, or how you could possibly contribute in the overall development of the project.

Eirik George Tsarpalis is a mathematician who's been a professional F# developer for the past 4 years. He's core developer and primary contributor to the MBrace project and has authored an assortment of open source tools including FsPickler, Argu, Vagabond and QuotationCompiler.

Per usual doors open at 6:30pm, talk begins at 7:00pm. The meetup is at the 67th floor conference center.

Don't forget a photo ID for security!
results.how_to_find_us: Sign in with security (north side of the first floor) and head to the 67th floor conference center
results.name: MBrace: REPL-driven scalable computation with Eirik Tsarpalis

results.description:
Topic

Spring Boot has become very popular in the two years since its inception. A major factor in this success has been a great demand for fast application development while a key "secret" has been to provide an opinionated solution without sacrificing power and flexibility.

Come to this session to hear the story of Spring Boot, find out how it works, and learn how it can improve your web development experience. We’ll start with a basic REST service and we’ll gradually expand the feature set to see how Boot can help to create more real-world web applications by adding functionality such as security and serving of static resources.

About the Speaker


Rossen Stoyanchev is a committer on the Spring Framework team with a strong focus on web development including Spring MVC and WebSocket messaging. Previously Rossen consulted and trained Spring teams for several years. He has been involved with Java and web development in various industries and domains since the mid 90s.<a href="http://lanyrd.com/profile/rstoyanchev/bio/"></a>


Agenda

6:30 Registration and Pizza

7-8pm Presentation

results.description:
To bridge the gap between modeling tools and WebGL engines, Khronos has recently introduced glTF (GL Transmission Format).  glTF is a simple, efficient, extensible, interoperable format for the transmission and loading of 3D content.  This tech talk introduces glTF and the open-source ecosystem of pipeline tools and runtime engines that support glTF.

Patrick Cozzi, @pjcozzi

At Analytical Graphics, Inc. (AGI), Patrick leads the development of Cesium, an open-source WebGL virtual globe and map engine. He is the editor of WebGL Insights, co-editor of OpenGL Insights, coauthor of 3D Engine Design for Virtual Globes, and a member of the editorial board for the Journal of Computer Graphics Techniques. Patrick frequently presents at SIGGRAPH and contributes to other book series. As part of Khronos, he is the co-creator of glTF.  Patrick teaches GPU Programming and Architecture at the University of Pennsylvania, where he earned a master's degree in computer science.


We will be serving pizza and drink courtesy of the Khronos Group.

Patrick will also be giving away free copies of WebGL Insights - an essential book for any WebGL programmer!
results.how_to_find_us: Corner of Broadway and Houston
results.name: Khronos WebGL Meetup: glTF - A simple and efficient model format Patrick Cozzi

Patrick will also be giving away free additionals of WebGL Insights - an essential book for any WebGL programmer!

results.description:
Get Creative with IoT @ littleBits™ with littleBits™ Lab + More


Learn about littleBits and get a chance to create cool creations at the new littleBits Pop-Up Store!

About littleBits

littleBits™ is on a mission to Democratize Hardware by empowering everyone to Create Inventions, large and small, with a platform of easy-to-use Electronic Building Blocks. The company was founded in 2011 by MIT Media Lab graduate, TED Senior Fellow, and cofounder of the Open Hardware Summit, Ayah Bdeir.

The littleBits library includes 10 kits and nearly 70 interoperable modules, with products sold in more than 100 countries around the world and in over 2,000 schools and maker spaces. littleBits products have won more than 25 tech and education awards.

About Lance Weiler: Digital Storytelling Lab @Columbia

Lance Weiler is a founding member and director of the Digital Storytelling Lab @Columbia. The lab explores new forms and functions of storytelling.

Lance is a storyteller, entrepreneur and thought leader. An alum of the Sundance Screenwriters Lab, Lance is recognized as a pioneer because of the way he mixes storytelling and technology. WIRED magazine named him “One of twenty-five people helping to re-invent entertainment.”

Lance is the Director of Experiential Learning and Applied Creativity at Columbia University. The appointment is part of a campus wide initiative entitled Learn Do Share an effort to R&D the future of learning and work by harnessing storytelling, game mechanics, design thinking and technology.

We thank Atmel an ongoing sponsor of IoT Central | NYC.


IoT Central will be charging a nominal fee for this event to help defray the cost of the lab experience. For registration online before Nov. 2 the cost is $7.50 per person. For registration online after Nov. 2 the cost is $12.50 per person. Payment is required for RSVP and you must be on the RSVP list to attend.

DESCRIPTION:
Shanghai dishes usually look red and shiny, for they are often pickled in wine and their cooking methods include baking, stewing, braising, steaming, deep-frying, etc. Fish, crab, chicken are "drunken" with spirits and are briskly cooked, steamed, or served raw. Salted meats and preserved vegetables are also commonly used to enhance the dish. Sugar is an important ingredient in Shanghai cuisine, especially when used in combination with soy sauce. Another characteristic is the use of a great variety of seafood. Rice is dominantly served over noodle or other wheat products.
Shanghai cuisine stresses on using condiments and keeping the original flavors of the materials and has features of being fresh, smooth and crispy. It aims at lightness in flavor, and beautifulness in decoration. The raw materials of Shanghai dishes are well cut, and the colors harmoniously arranged.
Now, special attention is being paid to low-sugar and low-fat food, a good quantity of vegetables and nutritional values.
Generally Shanghai cuisine is mellower and slightly sweet in taste. Sweet and sour is a typical Shanghai taste.

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't allow latecomers to enter.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003

THIS IS THE MEETUP FOR YOU. We'll be tackling questions like: Are you drawing comics? When are you going to draw comics? Why aren't you drawing comics right this moment? And so on and so forth. The answer to all these questions is: SHUT UP AND DRAW COMICS.

Drop on by, bring a friend, grab a beer or coffee, say hello, chat if you want, but DRAW COMICS.

We have a monthly meet and greet hangout meetup, and we also schedule drawing days, sketch days, convention visits, museum trips, whatever. If you have an idea for a meetup or a location you'd like to suggest, let me know!

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.

Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your FALL with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. results.description:
In this informal group we will consult this timeless oracle and use it as theme setter for contemplation. The I-Ching (Yijing, Book of Changes) is a helpful way to frame the energies of life and life matters, and leads us to self-understanding. It is also an enjoyable way to explore perennial philosophy and Taoist arts - the latter of which it actually predates. 

Did you know there is an Edgar Cayce’s readings version of the I-Ching? Yes, we will reference this too!  

Participants will be coached in framing queries, and as a part of a brief meditation allowed to privately select a query for response. The class will include consulting, drawing out an image, discussion and a few short periods of silent meditation with feedback.

Dress comfortably and be prepared to sit for a few periods of 3-5 minutes in silence, as you formulate your question and reflect on the answer. A notepad will be useful for those that wish to keep a record. Participants may bring their own version of the I-Ching if they wish. The workshop aims to give you a response on a personal matter and improve your knowledge base and skill in the I-Ching system. All are welcome.

Cost: $20 (ARE Members 15% off)

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
Opening Night of JCC Rockland's Festival of Arts, Books and Culture
Register online at jccrockland.org/abc

Tickets: $18 in advance / $23 at the door

A moving and revealing exploration of Hasidic life, and one man’s struggles with faith, family, and community.

Shulem Deen was raised to believe that questions are dangerous. As a member of the Skverers, one of the most insular Hasidic sects in the US, he knows little about the outside world—only that it is to be shunned. His marriage at eighteen is arranged and several children soon follow. Deen’s first transgression—turning on the radio—is small, but his curiosity leads him to the library, and later the Internet. Soon he begins a feverish inquiry into the tenets of his religious beliefs, until, several years later, his faith unravels entirely.

Now a heretic, he fears being discovered and ostracized from the only world he knows. His relationship with his family at stake, he is forced into a life of deception, and begins a long struggle to hold on to those he loves most: his five children. In All Who Go Do Not Return, Deen bravely traces his harrowing loss of faith, while offering an illuminating look at a highly secretive world.

Event followed by dessert reception

About The Author: Shulem Deen is the founding editor of Unpious, an online journal for voices on the Hasidic fringe. His work has appeared in The New Republic, Salon, Tablet Magazine, The Jewish Daily Forward, and elsewhere. He serves as a board member at Footsteps, a New York City-based organization that offers assistance and support to those who have left the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community. He lives in Brooklyn, New York.
results.name: Author Shulem Deen: All Who Go Do Not Return

results.description:
Dear Enneagram Group,

We'll continue the music series in November, in a new format intended to make it more interactive.  For those new to the series, we are exploring the world of music through an Enneagram lens, looking for how the Enneagram type of a musical creator manifests itself.  Typically, this means identifying the real-life type of a composer, and trying to see if we can "hear" something of the essence of this type in some aspect of his/her music.  In some cases (e.g., where a particular performance of a piece of music is very famous or influential), a performer might also be considered a co-creator (or a lyricist, choreographer, etc.), and the type of these co-creators might then also be relevant.  See the announcement for our Sept., 2015, meeting for more background.


New Format

At the suggestion of a group-member last time, we'll try asking everyone to try to contribute one short piece - a piece that for you evokes the essence of a particular Enneagram type (whatever type you choose).  Ideally, you will know the actual type of a principal creator of your piece (presumably, this will be the same type evoked), but if this isn't possible, just focus on the human qualities the a given piece of music evokes for you.

You shouldn't tell the group what type you have in mind - we'll just play the pieces contributed, and have a group discussion about how they strike all of us.

Of course, if you can't think of a piece to contribute, you are still welcome to attend, but if as many people as possible pitch in, it would help make for an interesting meeting.  There is no "right answer" - we're just looking for an example of a piece that means something human to you, in a type-identifiable way.  If you can think of many examples, consider picking a historically-important piece of music - one that's likely to mean something to others in the group.

Please pick a short piece of music - say, around three minutes - or, if you are drawn to longer pieces - try to identify a 2-3 minute important segment we can excerpt.  You can identify more than one piece if you like -we'll arrange as time allows.


Advance Submission Requested

Given that we might receive a pretty wide variety of types/genres, I think it would be helpful to arrange the contributed pieces thematically, rather than jumping all over the place - i.e., from classical, to rock'n'roll, to hip-hop (or, whatever) and back again.

Accordingly, if you could please email me with one (or perhaps two or three) pieces at least a bit ahead of the meeting - say by Monday, November 2, at noon - that would be a great help towards preparing something easier and more interesting to listen to than a random jumble.

You can email me by clicking the "contact" button below my picture under "Organizer" at left toward the top of the pages associated with our group.  A pop-up window should appear.

(There is no need to tell me what type of you have in mind, either.  We'll get to that part later.)


Media for Submitted Pieces


Last time, we played music using several media - some CD's I prepared, YouTube videos, and pieces on one member's mobile device.  I think the YouTube video medium probably worked best.  It's a practical way to find a great variety of music (for those not familiar, you can find many, many pieces there).  Also, the visuals add something to the group-listening experience - obviously, this is most significant for a singer-songwriter performing his/her own music.  But even for a long-dead classical composer, listening while watching an expressive soloist, group, or conductor can open up a another dimension.

Accordingly, please email me a YouTube link (or two or three), if you can.  You can copy and paste the link from another widow in your browser to the Meetup pop-up message-window.  If you can't find the piece you want on YouTube, try bringing a CD - or your own device, if nothing else works.  I will again have the large tablet-device I used last time, so we can all watch and listen together.


Looking forward to see you,

Nicholas

(Group Organizer)

PS - note on schedule - last time, I spoke of possibly moving our monthly meetings to first Mondays -  this may still happen, but not until early next year at the earliest.

results.description:
Brian introduces the oldest computer language there is - one that predates the Turing machine and digital computers both: the Lambda Calculus.  Despite being the oldest computer language there is, this language serves as the basis for the most powerful and advanced languages of today - Lisp and Haskell (as well as being a basis for mathematics and logic).

Brian will describe the entire langage, and give implementations for some "advanced" features - like numbers, booleans, tuples, and lists.  This will hopefully shed interesting light on the boundary between what qualifies as code and what qualifies as data.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Turandot

Exquisitely dramatic.  Nessun Dorma, one of the most beautiful songs from opera you will ever hear, is one you are promised to hear tonight in one of the most spectacularly produced operas, Turandot by Puccini.


Christine Goerke, Lise Lindstrom, and Nina Stemme, three of opera’s greatest dramatic sopranos, take turns in the title role of the proud princess of legendary China. Tenors Marcelo Álvarez and Marco Berti are Calàf, the brave prince who sings “Nessun dorma” and wins her hand. Franco Zeffirelli’s golden production is conducted by Paolo Carignani.


Turandot in Verona 2014:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-aUyBvFpY7k

Luciano Pavarotti with Nessun Dorma:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lMD_5UzjdqQ 

Act I 


Outside the Imperial Palace in Peking, a mandarin reads an edict to the crowd: any prince seeking to marry the princess Turandot must answer three riddles. If he fails, he will die. The most recent suitor, the Prince of Persia, is to be executed at the moon’s rising. Among the onlookers are the slave girl Liù, her aged master, and the young Calàf, who recognizes the old man as his long lost father, Timur, vanquished King of Tartary. When Timur reveals that only Liù has remained faithful to him, Calàf asks why. She replies that once, long ago, Calàf smiled at her. The mob cries for blood but greets the rising moon with a sudden fearful silence. When the Prince of Persia is led to his execution, the crowd calls upon the princess to spare him. Turandot appears, and with a contemptuous gesture orders that the execution proceed. As the victim’s death cry is heard from the distance, Calàf, transfixed by the beauty of the unattainable princess, strides to the gong that announces a new suitor. Suddenly Turandot’s three ministers, Ping, Pang, and Pong, appear to discourage him. Timur and the tearful Liù also beg him not to risk his life (“Signore, ascolta!”). Calàf tries to comfort her (“Non piangere, Liù”) but then strikes the gong and calls Turandot’s name.

Act II 


Inside the palace, Ping, Pang, and Pong lament Turandot’s bloody reign, praying that love will conquer her heart and restore peace. The three let their thoughts wander to their peaceful country homes (Trio: “Ho una casa nell’Honan”), but the noise of the people gathering to hear Turandot question the new challenger calls them back to reality.

The old emperor asks Calàf to reconsider, but he will not be dissuaded. Turandot enters and describes how her beautiful ancestor, Princess Lou-Ling, was abducted and killed by a conquering prince. In revenge, she has turned against men and determined that none shall ever possess her (“In questa reggia”). Facing Calàf, she poses her first question: What is born each night and dies each dawn? “Hope,” Calàf answers, correctly. Turandot continues: What flickers red and warm like a flame, yet is not a flame? “Blood,” Calàf replies after a moment’s thought. Shaken, Turandot delivers the third riddle: What is like ice but burns? Tense silence prevails until Calàf triumphantly cries, “Turandot!” The crowd erupts in joy, and the princess vainly begs her father not to give her to the stranger. Hoping to win her love, Calàf offers Turandot a challenge of his own: if she can learn his name by dawn, he will forfeit his life.


Act III 

In the Imperial Gardens, Calàf hears a proclamation: on pain of death no one in Peking shall sleep until Turandot learns the stranger’s name. Calàf is certain of his victory (“Nessun dorma!”), but Ping, Pang, and Pong try to bribe him to leave the city. As the fearful mob threatens him to learn his name, soldiers drag in Liù and Timur. Calàf tries to convince the crowd that neither of them knows his secret. When Turandot appears, commanding Timur to speak, Liù replies that she alone knows the stranger’s identity and will never reveal it. She is tortured but remains silent. Impressed by such fortitude, Turandot asks Liù’s secret. It is love, she replies. When the soldiers intensify the torture, Liù tells Turandot that she, too, will know the joys of love (“Tu, che di gel sei cinta”). Then she snatches a dagger and kills herself. The crowd forms a funeral procession and the body is taken away. Turandot remains alone to confront Calàf, who impetuously kisses her (Duet: “Principessa di morte!”). Knowing emotion for the first time, Turandot weeps (“Del primo pianto”). Calàf, now sure of winning her, reveals his identity.

Once again before the emperor’s throne, Turandot declares she knows the stranger’s name: it is Love.


Tickets

Please visit metopera.org.  Click on calendar.  Select November 3's date.  Select the Turandot evening performance.  Then, select your seat of choice. 

Meeting Details

7:00 pm We will meet in the lobby, in front of the gift shop.  It is located on the right side of the ticket office. I will send out my cell phone number via group email the night before the event. 

We will also meet at intermission on the lower level (parking level) lounge for drinks or tea. There are high tops there and it is less frequented so it will be comfortable for making conversation between acts. 

See you soon!
results.name: Turandot!  Metropolitan Opera

results.description:
Dorothy Cummings and Orly Krasner will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment by The Gotham Gals.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest! 

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.name: English Country Dance with Dorothy Cummings, Orly Krasner, and The Gotham Gals!

results.description:
A great offer has been extended to the group to see the new film release of "Brooklyn", featuring Saoirse Ronan, Domhnall Gleeson, Emory Cohen, Jim Broadbent and Julie Walters

ABOUT MOVIE
BROOKLYN tells the profoundly moving story of Ellis Lacey, a young Irish immigrant navigating her way through 1950s Brooklyn. Lured by the promise of America, Ellis departs Ireland and the comfort of her mother's home for the shores of New York City. The initial shackles of homesickness quickly diminish as a fresh romance sweeps Ellis into the intoxicating charm of love. But soon, her vivacity is disrupted by her past, and Ellis must choose between two countries and the lives that exist within.

HOW TO GET YOUR PASSES
Each pass is you PLUS a guest and no cost!
Please go to the link:
http://www.foxsearchlightscreenings.com/BmiAJ85756 There is a limit at the moment for 25 passes for two. You can come on your own or with a friend.

If we find we have extra we can add more - and I may be able to request more as well.

For those interested we can connect for a mini social / bites / bevvies following.

results.description:
How often do we take the time to slow down, tune in to what our body needs, massage and stretch our muscles?

We live in a culture that values always being in action, either at our computer or at the gym (or even the yoga studio!).

But taking the time to stretch is just as important, both for its physical benefits as well as its psychological, emotional and spiritual ones.

It improves our range of motion, while also stretching our range of emotion.

- Release tightness and tension from your muscles
- Improve flexibility and circulation
- Relieve lower back pain
- Stress relief
- Deeper breathing, which leads to feelings of spaciousness and well-being
- Reconnecting with the body, leaving us feeling more whole, aware and capable of dealing with life's challenges
- Release 'happy' hormones
- Connect with the senses, sensuality and release shame around our body

We will start with a guided meditation, followed by deep breathing and slow stretching.

Please bring a yoga mat, a pen and journal, and dress comfortably.

See you on the mat!

Love always,

Melody

Sensual Meditative Stretching: Release Stress and Befriend Your Body

Tuesday November 3, 7-8 pm

Location TBD in New York, NY

$5 donation until Oct 30, $10 after

Register

NOTE: in order to cover costs, this meetup requires at least 4 people to be signed up and paid for through the link above 24 hrs prior for it to happen. Please RSVP mindfully.

----------------------------
ABOUT MELODY KIERSZ
Melody Kiersz holds a degree in Happiness from the prestigious New York University, is a Certified Holistic Health Counselor graduated from the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, a member of the American Association of Drugless Practitioners, and a Certified Yoga Teacher through Jungle Yoga Ashram.

Melody is a deep listener and reads between the lines to guide you in discovering the ways you're holding yourself back from your true expression. She specializes in healing our relationship with our bodies, our selves and others, improving body image and self-esteem, increasing our ability to speak up, share, and allow ourselves to be seen and loved as we are. As the Founder of Naked Wellness, her goal is to guide you as you peel all those layers of resistance so you can turn yourself on for a life full of health, passion, power, freedom, joy and pleasure.

Based in New York City, Melody offers in-person and long-distance private sessions, and is really passionate about everyone really getting that they are absolutely perfect exactly as they are.

Find out more at nakedwellness.com

This meetup is held the first Tuesday of each month and has two purposes.

First, it serves as a general networking opportunity for Permies in the area to meet each other and to provide mutual aid. What are you working on and where? What kind of collaborators and skills sets do you want to add to your team? Do you have an idea that you'd like to share just for feedback and exploration?

Second, this is an information session to increase knowledge about the numerous ways that permaculture can be applied in the world, from gardening/farming practices and land stewardship, to regenerative economic systems, community building, and nature connection.

results.description:
Thank you to everyone for coming to October's Smutty Book Club.  It was clear passions and opinions ran hot with This Man by Jodi Ellen Malpas - loved it or hated it, we all finished it and most bought the next two books :)  We are eagerly waiting for Heidi to post Benedict Cumberbatch's description of Sherlock Holmes' take on sex. It was great seeing some of you at Comic Con, sorry to those we missed! Please bring your pictures to the next book club! 

The book for November 3rd is A Hunger Like No Other by Kreseley Cole.  Recommended by Lindsey, AKA Batgirl if you saw her at NY Comic Con.  

In keeping with tradition, this is a Supernatural book for Halloween!  But don't worry, we are promised the book doesn't take forever setting up the universe, it's pretty self explanatory.  

Here's what the publisher says: 

A mythic warrior who'll stop at nothing to possess her...
After enduring years of torture from the vampire horde, Lachlain MacRieve, leader of the Lykae Clan, is enraged to find the predestined mate he's waited millennia for is a vampire. Or partly one. This Emmaline is a small, ethereal half Valkyrie/half vampire, who somehow begins to soothe the fury burning within him.
A vampire captured by her wildest fantasy...
Sheltered Emmaline Troy finally sets out to uncover the truth about her deceased parents—until a powerful Lykae claims her as his mate and forces her back to his ancestral Scottish castle. There, her fear of the Lykae—and their notorious dark desires—ebbs as he begins a slow, wicked seduction to sate her own dark cravings.
An all-consuming desire...
Yet when an ancient evil from her past resurfaces, will their desire deepen into a love that can bring a proud warrior to his knees and turn a gentle beauty into the fighter she was born to be?


Here's what the people say: 

Jessica H on Goodreads: This book had a slow start, but finished with a bang!


Vered on Goodreads: A nice story, nice writing, nice sex.Two problems: 1. This I'll kidnap you and hold you prisoner until you love me thing is a bit hummm unsettling. 2. It seems like too many of the PNR/UF heroines tend to be, well, annoying. Either the kick ass annoying or the wimpy annoying. 

So there you have it. Download, pick-up, or borrow the book.  Enjoy these sexy vampires, werewolves, demons, valkyries, shape-shifters, wraiths, witches and more.  Have a Happy Halloween and see you on November 3rd at Smutty Book Club! 

Dawn 

http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000GCFCXW?keywords=a%20hunger%20like%20no%20other&qid=1444673772&ref_=sr_1_1&s=books&sr=1-1
results.how_to_find_us: We are the loud laughing people in the back. Follow the signs.
results.name: Monthly Smutty Book Club - A Hunger Like No Other by Kresley Cole

results.description:
In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the richness of whats happening in relationship with others, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness. You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, " in the moment" conversations Ive seen become possible for them.

Likewise, the more Ive seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, grow in a sense of presence and natural interest in others, and generally embody a deep capacity for presence and authenticity.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! The cost is $20
results.name: Tuesday Night Circling: Creating Connection and Presence

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: devbootcamp

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!
results.name: Tuesday Office Hours

results.description:
We will be meeting at Info Commons in room # 2.

PLEASE NOTE that we limit attendance to better insure that all get a chance to have their writing critiqued.  If our maximum for the week is reached, you have the option of being notified when someone changes their RSVP to no.  PLEASE DO NOT RSVP YES UNLESS YOU ARE AS SURE AS IS HUMANLY POSSIBLE THAT YOU WILL BE ABLE TO ATTEND AND CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO NO IMMEDIATELY if your situation does change, for the sake of those waiting for a spot.  


Join us for a weekly get together of sometimes frank and hopefully always constructive criticism of your literary work. There is no restriction on the type of genre and only a few rules:

1. Bring up to 6 double spaced typed pages of your work for reading. Additional copies would be helpful in order to allow others in the group to follow along.

2. The author is not allowed to speak while feedback is being provided.

3. The same piece should not be reread at a future workshop.

We will meet every Tuesday at 7 PM on the first floor of the Central Library, unless a meetup is not scheduled for that date due to a holiday or other event. A floor plan link is available at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/sites/default/files/files/pdf/central/floorplan.pdf.

More information about the Brooklyn Central Library, including available public transportation options, can be found at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/locations/central.

Hope to see all of you there.

David
results.name: David's Writers Workshop

results.description:
Let's participate in Hudson Valley Restaurant Week by going to the Twisted Oak in Tarrytown on Tuesday Nov 3rd starting at 7pm. We will be seated at 7:30.  Your $3 fee will secure your spot. 

The region is celebrating Fall Hudson Valley Restaurant Week presented by The Valley Table from November 2-15 with an impressive list of restaurants. You have two whole weeks to eat your way through the Hudson Valley, giving you plenty of time to try new eateries and return to old favorites, all offering amazing prix-fixe menus at a discounted price.

From Yonkers to Kingston, restaurants will offer special three-course lunch ($20.95) and dinner menus ($29.95), plus tip, tax and drinks of course!  Guests (21 years of age and older) can pair those meals with the local wines and cocktails.So what are you waiting for… lets eat!

Chef Michael Cutney's newest Venture The Twisted Oak, takes a fun and casual approach to New American Fare with Italian Influences. Sourcing from Local Farmers and Growers,The Twisted Oak offers a daily changing menu featuring ingredients from the Hudson Valleys' Bounty. Located just steps away from the famed Tarrytown Music Hall, the Restaurant is set in a turn of the century photography studio. The main dining room is dressed with paintings from local artists and the bar, which was handcrafted from Oak Wine Barrels, you can expect to find boutique wines, seasonal cocktails, and local brews. The Twisted Oak is quickly becoming a neighborhood favorite with its delicious food, refined service, and excellent hospitality.


Check out their menu and picts on their facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/The.Twisted.Oak.Restaurant?fref=ts

They haven't posted their RW menu yet, but when it is posted I will add it here.. in the meantime, rsvp - as they do not take parties larger than 6 !  Your $3 fee will secure you a spot for this hot upcoming restaurant..

results.description:
The Better Angels of Our Nature: Why Violence Has Declined by Steven Pinker, the Times bestseller will be discussed at this month's book club.

Believe it or not, today we may be living in the most peaceful moment in our species' existence. In his gripping and controversial new work, New York Times bestselling author Steven Pinker shows that despite the ceaseless news about war, crime, and terrorism, violence has actually been in decline over long stretches of history. Exploding myths about humankind's inherent violence and the curse of modernity, this ambitious book continues Pinker's exploration of the essence of human nature, mixing psychology and history to provide a remarkable picture of an increasingly enlightened world.


This event is hosted by Bob Braine. for information on this month's book, email [masked]. This event is FREE and OPEN TO THE PUBLIC.
results.name: The Better Angels of Our Nature: Why Violence Has Declined by Steven Pinker

results.description:
In this course you will learn how to use the Arduino to control many types and sizes of motors - from tiny motors the size of a fingernail to hacked cordless drills.  After this two hour course you will know how to select motors for their various purposes and how to write the software that drives the motors at different speeds and direction and to confirm that the commands have been carried out properly.

Reviews from our previous courses:


• "Awesome! I'd definitely go to a follow-up."

• "Great workshop, just the right touch to whet my appetite."

Requirements

We will provide laptops and Arduinos for participants.


About The Rockland County Makerspace and CILK119


This course is hosted by the Rockland County Makerspace @CILK119 (www.cilk119.com), a co-working space located in Nanuet, NY.  

Dr. Duncan Bell is a life-long tinkerer who graduated from making go-karts and skateboards to designing industrial robots that support pharmaceutical research. Along the way he earned a PhD in Botany and Biophysics and conducted research in Scotland, Italy, and the United States in photosynthesis, cancer, and arthritis. In addition to spreading the word about the fantastic capabilities of the current generation of microcontrollers, he heads up a small company that develops custom storefront displays with coordinated motion and lighting—all driven by Arduinos. Recently, his Arduino-based float was a prize winner at the Nyack Halloween parade and his Persistence of Vision special effect was featured in Elmwood Playhouse’s recent production of “Sunday in the Park with George.” 

Attendees at a recent Arduino Course

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
Universal Basic Income is a public system under which every citizen of a country receives an unconditional sum of money, either from the government or other public institution. 

Over the last several years, this concept has begun to take traction, as tests of UBI have been met with success in pilot groups within Nimibia and India. Researchers report that there are major benefits to this type of system, including higher productivity and employment.

Brendan Lauer will kick off this Think Tank with an overview of the research behind UBI. We'll then launch into a detailed discussion on various applications in the US and developed countries (including negative income taxes). 


A brief overview of UBI can be found here >>>

Can't wait. RSVP now to save your spot - a resource list will follow in the next few days.

Cheers!

Dan
results.name: Universal Basic Income with Brendan Lauer

results.description:
Questions/Scriptures to be discussed include:

1. Why does God permit so much evil in the world?
2. What does mankind's future look like, as per the Bible?
3. Are science and faith mutually exclusive? Could they be reconciled with each other?
4. What happens when a man dies?
5. What has happened over 2000 years of church history and how has that changed Christianity from its original version?
6. Can the Bible be harmonized from Genesis to Revelation? Does it contradict itself anywhere?
7. What is the Kingdom of Heaven?
8. Why did Jesus tell so many parables (more than 90%) about his upcoming Kingdom?
9. What's the purpose of this Kingdom of God?
10. Why is it taking so long to come? Hasn't it been 2000 years since Jesus?
results.name: Tuesday Evening Bible Study (Newport)

results.description:
At the initial stage of business development it is not an easy task to look into the future to determine who will share and in what proportion in the value created by the company. Outside investors and other circumstances may significantly change the initial structure of ownership. However, there are certain matters that founders must consider and implement in the company’s formation documents should they want to preserve certain control over the company in spite of the possible changes, ensure certain privileges for themselves as being the originators of the idea, and avoid undesirable tax consequences should the price of the company’s stock raise.

During this meet up we will review the following considerations:

•  Should founders pay for their stock in cash or contribute intellectual property?

• Should founders stock be subject to vesting before a venture financing?

• What should the vesting terms of founder stock be before a venture financing?

• What is an IRS 83(b) election?

• What is qualified small business stock?

• What is Series FF stock?

• What is Class F common stock?

and many other substantial issues.

Followed by informal networking.
results.name: FOUNDERS ISSUES

results.description:
IMPROV FOR ACTORS - Just for Fun

This Improve with Improvworkshop will focus on having more fun on stage. Many actors get so bogged down and overwhelmed with learning and practicing their craft, preparing for auditions, competing for jobs, etc., that they stop enjoying themselves.

This workshop will be a series of games, exercises and scenes done just for the sheer fun of it! Get back in touch with the childlike enjoyment of performance that inspired you to pursue acting in the first place.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.

Suggested Donation: $15*


*free drink with $15 donation

*most improv classes in NYC cost $35-$50 per session or more.

In the end, if you haven't decided who to vote in, you will have gotten a great workout.

results.description:
SPECIAL NOTE TO MEMBERS:

NOVEMBER 3RD IS ALSO ELECTION DAY. PLEASE VOTE BEFORE OUR MEETING.

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

Please join us at our November General Meeting of the Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots-  Tuesday, November 3rd, at 7:00 PM.

This month we feature the movie "IRANIUM"

Iran’s nuclear program presents a threat to international stability.  Yet successive American administrations—Republican and Democratic alike—have misread the intentions and actions of the Iranian regime.

How dangerous is a nuclear Iran, even if it never detonates a weapon?  What are the guiding principles of the Iranian leadership?  To what lengths would the regime go to carry out its agenda?  How far have Iran’s leaders already gone to fund the world’s most powerful terrorist organizations?  And why have American leaders failed to gain the upper hand in relations with Iran during the past 30 years?

In approximately 60 minutes, Iranium powerfully reports on the many aspects of the threat America and the world now face using rarely-before seen footage of Iranian leaders, and interviews with 25 leading politicians, Iranian dissidents, and experts on: Middle East policy, terrorism, and nuclear proliferation.

Iranium documents the development of Iran’s nuclear threat, beginning with the Islamic Revolution of 1979 and the ideology installed by Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khomeini.Iranium tracks Iran’s use of terror as a tool of policy, beginning with the 444 day seizure of the U.S. Embassy in Tehran, through Iran’s insurgent actions in Iraq and Afghanistan.Iranium details the brutal nature of the Iranian regime to its own citizens, and the Iranian people’s desire to rejoin the international community.Iranium outlines the various scenarios the greater Middle East and the Western world may face should Iran cross the nuclear threshold.

**************************************************************************

Also, "Bob Dann's Tea Party University", and his specially  hand picked "Video(s) of the Month".


***************************************************************************

Don't forget to purchase your 50/50 raffle tickets at all of our meetings. Last month's winner walked away with  $150.00! Get a full arm's length of tickets for only $10.00. You can use your arm, our arm, or the really tall guy with the long arms sitting next to you!!

Remember, we use the proceeds of our monthly raffle sales to help offset the costs of running our meetings. Please participate, and be generous!

*****************************************************************

Please Note:

Speakers and agenda times listed above are subject to change. With only a few exceptions our General Meetings are held the first Tuesday of every month from 7:00 to 9:00 PM at the American Legion Hall, 197 Maple Avenue Rockville Centre. All of our meetings are open to the public. Doors open around 6:30 for early-birds, shmoozers, and those wishing to help us set up the meeting. Our actual meeting begins at 7 PM.

All are welcome. Bring your neighbors, bring your friends!

We respectfully request that you RSVP your attendance to all of our meetings and events regardless of if you are able to attend or not. Simply click the link contained inside this invitation to RSVP.  Please do it now. Thank You.

results.description:
Fun Home is one of Broadway's biggest hits -- winning this year's Best New Musical Tony Award! But did you know it was adapted from a graphic novel memoir by cartoonist Alison Bechdel? This meeting we'll explore the world of Beech Creek, PA, as we discuss the book version of Fun Home (though thoughts on the show are welcome as well). 

Pick up a copy of the book at the Bellmore Library, just ask for it at the Circulation Desk, and mention that your with the coffehouse graphic novel book club. This club is open to all, Bellmore residency is not required, so join us!

Questions or comments? Call librarian Valerie Acklin at (516)[masked] or email at [masked].
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the back!
results.name: Book Club Kickoff: Fun Home!

results.description:
Please Join us on November 3rd

Guest Teacher

Carl Chimon Viggiani, Sensei

We are fortunate to have Carl Viggiani, Sensei visit with us.

Carl is a Dharma Heir of Robert Kennedy, SJ, Roshi.

Carl began formal study of Zen Buddhism with the Japanese Teacher Eido Roshi in 1987, later moving to Dai Bosatsu Zendo, Eido Roshi's monastery in the Catskills, where he lived and practiced until 1993. He continued with Daido Loori Roshi at Zen Mountain Monastery, and with Roshi Robert Kennedy at Morning Star Zendo in Jersey City.

He will sit, offer daisan (one to one teaching) in the second period and a Dharma talk in the last period.

Please Join Us!

Questions or comments? Contact us at:

E-Mail: [masked]

We will accommodate all levels so if you are New or have been shaking it for awhile come down and join us. There is plenty of room to grow here.

Zumba for ALL! - The Zumba® program fuses hypnotic Latin rhythms and easy-to-follow moves to create a one-of-a-kind fitness program that will blow you away. Our goal is simple: We want you to want to work out, to love working out, to get hooked. Zumba® Fanatics achieve long-term benefits while experiencing an absolute blast in one exciting hour of calorie-burning, body-energizing, awe-inspiring movements meant to engage and captivate for life!

The routines feature interval training sessions where fast and slow rhythms and resistance training are combined to tone and sculpt your body while burning fat. Add some Latin flavor and international zest into the mix and you’ve got a Zumba® class!

Prices: $15.00 walk-in or $100 /10 class punch card $75/6 class punch card  *Our current specials - *1st time at our class your walk-in price only $10!       *Bring 2 Friends Get $5 off your next walk-in or punch card purchase.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
Join us Tuesday for West Coast Swing at Slate, a cool venue with wood floors, mood lighting, great sound system, yummy drinks & fun dancing. Extended Happy Hour for dancers from 4pm until 9 pm!

Leveled Lessons We are excited to offer two leveled classes from 7:30 - 8:30 pm, NO PARTNER needed! Dancers rotate during class. Each week will focus on a different set of skills and will help take each dancer to the next level of their dancing! The level 1 class is for anyone who would like to learn the basics of west coast swing. The level 2 class is for dancers who have learned and are comfortable with the basics. Click for complete Class Details.


Free Games Slate is offering free games to dancers from 7:30 - 8:30 pm when you buy a drink or food. You can play pool, ping pong, shuffleboard, and more. It is an awesome deal and a great way to relax after work.

Dance Party Party with rotating DJs spinning fantastic West Coast Swing tunes from 8:30pm until midnight! The party is $12 at the door or prepay online for $10. Get $5 cash back if you spend $20+ at the bar.

Credit cards accepted at admission desk.  Credit cards accepted at admission desk. No outside food, water or drinks. 21+ over event only ID required.


Check out NOWDancing.com for more information and to Register!

results.description:
Help make freeganism happen in NYC! After brief report-backs on ongoing projects, we will have an open, facilitated discussion on a topic of freegan interest. Bring your ideas and opinions and let's talk! We welcome both those with experience taking part in non-hierarchical consensus-based groups and those participating for the first time. At 9pm, we will end our business meeting and have a brief, newcomer-friendly discussion about freeganism before the trash tour. The meeting is NOT open to media.

Newcomers are always welcome and encouraged to attend our full meeting, but if you ONLY want an introduction to freeganism and to dumpster dive, DON'T sign up for this meeting! See the next one (Freeganism 101 and Trash Tour, later the same evening).

If you have trouble finding us, call Janet:[masked]-6954.

results.description: • Austerlitz is the story of a man’s search for the answer to his life’s central riddle. A small child when he comes to England on a Kindertransport in the summer of 1939, Jacques Austerlitz is told nothing of his real family by the Welsh Methodist minister and his wife who raise him. When he is a much older man, fleeting memories return to him, and obeying an instinct he only dimly understands, Austerlitz follows their trail back to the world he left behind a half century before. There, faced with the void at the heart of twentieth-century Europe, he struggles to rescue his heritage from oblivion.
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the doorman for the Meetup Group in the Library off the Lobby

Is it possible to have too much Origami? In the world of OMG never!

This is our Weekly Tuesday Folder's meeting at Argo Tea on University Place near Union Square!

If you have models you would like to learn or teach, let me know and we will try our best to accommodate.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold!

hope to see you there! happy folding!!

It would be great for you to RSVP if you plan on attending so others will know you will be there. Thanks and happy folding!

-Sok

NOTE: reminders emails for WTF will not be sent out because it will always be at the same time and same place and same day of the week and I am trying my best not to send out too many mass emails for the group! So check back here on the website for any changes and updates or cancellations ;)

results.description:
Bring out your best poems, stories, memoir excerpts, flash fiction… it's open mic night for writers, hosted by the Art Cafe Nyack and River River Writers Circle. Sign-ups start at 7:30 p.m., with a 5-minute limit per reader. We'll have the quiet, back-porch room of the cafe. There's no requirement to order anything to participate, but if you would like to, please order and pick up at the counter.

We'll continue this open mic on the first and third Tuesday of every month, so, mark your calendars and spread the word!

The Montclair Socrates Cafe Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Come on out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition! Test your skills as New York Social Network Founder Dave Cervini hosts a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. We will have special sections set aside for NYSN members to meet and team up.  Pay as you go for food and drink. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round!

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but The Firehouse is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? The Firehouse is known for it's wings. But they also have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stayb and socialize and other head home.

How do I get there? It is near the corner of west 85th and Columbus Avenue.  The B,C stop a block away at CPW and 86th and the #1 stops at B'way and 86th.

This event is being hosted by The New York Social Network  WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM  and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP’s below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending. (We have a 3 flakes and you’re out rule). If you have any questions regarding this or any of our events please contact Dave Cervini directly at [masked] or call[masked]
