results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

The show is totally free, and we even give away a few drinks just for the hell of it. Hope to see you all there!

results.name: SCP meetup.

results.description:
If you are new to the city, recently out, just looking for friends, or whatever experiences brought you to us - we also offer a safe space where we can mingle and talk about our experiences as an LGBT person in New York City. We hold a space in the Manhattan Center and the Brooklyn Pride Center for icebreakers and discussions. You can hit up one or both in a month! We recommend this to anyone who is looking for a more casual space to explore their sexual/gender identity. 

We will be screening the film "Paris is Burning": a documentary focusing on drag queens living in New York City and their "house" culture, which provided a sense of community and support for the flamboyant and often socially shunned performers.

We accept a $5 donation. 

There’ll also be refreshments! 


Bring friends! 

IMPORTANT: The center can be a tad hard to find. It is on the corner of Gold Street and Willoughby Street, in the lobby next to the Subway restaurant. We will have a post outside of the lobby also telling people where to go.
results.name: First Tuesdays at the Brooklyn Pride Center! Screening "Paris is Burning"!

Come to win a drink or two, make some new friends, see old ones, and play a fun and intellectually stimulating game of Trivia!

Great times and great friends!  New and returning members welcome!

<a href="http://pre-dating.takeitnational.net/tin/index.php?m=customer&s=coordmemberlookup&membernumber=2516956&region=DAY&Submit=">Join us for our next FREE Dating and Relationship Teleseminar 

"The Art of Flirting: Creating Attraction and Connection through Playfulness and Polarity"

with Guest Speaker Roy Biancalana, Relationship Coach and Author

WHEN: Tuesday, November 3rd, 2015 from 8:30 PM to 9:45 PM (ET)
SPEAKER:Relationship Coach, and Author Roy Biancalana
WHO'S INVITED: This Teleseminar is Open to EVERYONE 
HOW MUCH: Complimentary! 
HOW TO RSVP: http://predatingteleseminar.eventbrite.com 

Join Pre-Dating’s official relationship coach, Roy Biancalana, for a provocative and powerful seminar where you will learn:

•  How to tease and toy your way to a first date

• Unleash your secret flirting weapon

• The 3 keys to successful flirting 

• The hidden barriers to being a great flirt 

• Exactly what to say (and what not to say) when flirting The difference between conventional and conscious flirting

PLUS All attendees will receive:

• One free 30 Minute Exploratory Coaching Session

• Special discounts from on Roy's many programs

• And more!

ABOUT OUR SPEAKER -

Roy Biancalana: is known as "The Intimacy Guru," and is a nationally recognized leader in the field of attraction, intimacy and conscious relationships. He appears regularly on Fox35 TV in Orlando, FL as their relationship expert and is the author of the book, "A Drink with Legs" sold worldwide.

Roy is a certified relationship coach, spiritual teacher and was a PGA Tour player. His passion is working with men and women who are committed to awakening to their true spiritual nature and experiencing the love life they most desire. He specializes in supporting single people in attracting the love of their lives and also helping those who are in committed partnerships experience a deeper level of intimacy. He has clients all over the world and coaches by phone, Skype or in person.

Missed a past teleseminar? Recordings available at http://www.pre-dating.com/teleseminar/

REMEMBER:

If you somehow can't make the call, everyone who RSVPs will receive access to the recording replay and bonuses in a follow-up email after this free teleseminar.

**Although this a FREE teleseminar, standard long distance charges may apply. Listeners may listen online as well, an online audio link will also be supplied when you RSVP.

EVENT TYPE: Dining

DESCRIPTION:
10Below Ice Cream is New York’s first establishment serving Thai-inspired ice cream rolls. This concept was created on the streets of Thailand, serving fresh, made-to-order ice cream. Inspired by this ice cream art and by the way bartenders artfully craft cocktails made to order, 10Below blends the two approaches to create an experience for ice cream aficionados with an eclectic palette. We roll each individual ice cream order with the freshest ingredients right in front of your eyes, meaning no preservatives or stabilizers are added. It’s ice cream in its rawest form -- fresh off the plate.

http://www.10belowicecream.com/#!menu/cff9

http://www.yelp.com/biz/10below-ice-cream-new-york-3

O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Wake up. Work out. DONE!


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4KKltxVko4w

This is a core strength workout. We do boot camp style exercises, so think pushups, situps, planks, squats, burpees, etc. And there's a lot of high fives, smiles, and laughing involved, too...

Not sure how to do burpees? Pike jumps? Dragon Pushups? That's fine! We'll teach you. This is an awesome way to rock your body and get fit fast.


We welcome all fitness levels! Even if you have not worked out in years we want you to join us. Working out with fun, encouraging people in a group setting is better than trying to do this all on your own. EVERYBODY IS WELCOME!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us in front of the NY Public Library!

results.description:
Do you like getting up early and starting the day with inspiring conversations or even better: pair programming on your pet project? This is your meetup! :) 

Skip the morning run and instead meet us between 6:30 AM and 9:30 AM bi-weekly to chat, code and have the first coffee together to start the day off with developers or other software professionals who care about the quality of the code and passionately looking for ways to improve themselves. 

The venue: There is a Starbucks open from 5:30 am and behind it the lobby of The Lexington NYC hotel, which is a pretty cool space, they have free, fast wi-fi, plenty of seating and a lot of sockets in the wall :) I asked, and we are allowed to gather so don't be shy and have a look around. There are seats downstairs and on the mezzanine as well, upstairs, where the restrooms are too. See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: If you're unsure, comment on the meetup, but people with laptops downstairs at the big table is a good starting point.

results.description:
Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals. Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Business Developers provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.


To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/nj-newark-bni-business-developers-of-morristown/chapter_members.php


If you or someone you know are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out. Email with questions or for more information.

You may have attended networking group meetings before, but you haven’t seen ours!  We are a growing chapter that maintains a unique sense of partnership as well as camaraderie. Come to a meeting where you will meet other local business people as well as have an opportunity to tell us about your business.


We meet every Wednesday 7 :15am at the Maywood Pancake House, our meeting begins 7:30am.

We are seeking all professions to join our group. However our group is very unique and attractive as it is one seat per profession. We currently have the following seats filled:

 • Personal and Commercial P&C Insurance (Borbotko Insurance Group)

• Retirement Planner (Ameriprise) 

• Long Term Care and Life Insurance (Ameriprise) 

• Reverse Mortgage Banker (1st Constitution Bank) 

• Business Banker (Santander) 

• Mortgage Banker (Franklin First Financial) 

• Certified Public Accountant (KWC Partners, LLC) 

• Real Estate and Trust Attorney (Yaneixa Hermoso PC Attorneys at Law) 

• Realtor (RE/MAX) 

• Web and Graphic Design (Jersey Girls Creative)

• Promotional Items/Printer (Ramsey Graphics & Printing)

If your company is not part of the categories listed above and you're interested in growing your business with a local group on a weekly basis this may be a perfect fit! Come as a guest to see the power of our group!

Read more about us here www.LetipSaddlebrook.com

results.description:
Big Data Everywhere New York is a half-day conference focused on Hadoop and surrounding technologies that will bring together users and developers to share their experience about these projects via multiple presentations and user success stories. Industry experts will exchange Hadoop knowledge, share best practices, and discuss Hadoop use cases.

Tickets are half-price for SQL/NoSQL NYC Meetup members (join at http://www.NYCSQL.com) - we can attend a big data conference for just 24-bucks!

Registration includes free breakfast and a networking lunch!

Register NOW, seats are limited!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932

50%-off discount code: SQLNYC

Hear about real-world Hadoop delployments and other tales from the trenches of big data!

Speakers include:

• Vice President of IT for Morgan Stanley

• Chief Application Architect at MapR

• CTO of Nvent Data

• Cisco's Big Data Consulting Systems Engineer

• CIO of Pico

• Apache Mahout, Drill, & ZooKeeper Projects Committer

• CEO of Zaloni

Topics include:

• ​Morgan Stanley's Big Data Journey 

• Secure Collaboration on Big Data: Locking Down Doesn't Mean Locking Out

• Leverage a Hadoop Data Lake to Address Risk Data Aggregation and Risk Reporting

• The Transformational Influence of Big Data in the Global Capital Markets

• Odyssey: A Look at The Evolution of Big Data Ingestion Pipelines

• Cisco IT's Hadoop Journey

Register TODAY, seats are limited!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932
50%-off code: SQLNYC

Conference sessions:

Leverage a Hadoop Data Lake to address Risk Data Aggregation and Risk Reporting by Ben Sharma, CEO, Zaloni

Addressing risk data aggregation and risk reporting (RDARR) is a challenge today for many reasons, including data accuracy and integrity, data completeness, and ensuring that you have a data architecture that can support normal and high stress scenarios. During this presentation, Ben Sharma will address how a “managed” Hadoop data lake can serve as an ideal data acquisition hub for RDARR analytics and reporting. He will address architectural considerations and required capabilities.

Odyssey: A Look at The Evolution of Big Data Ingestion Pipelines by Steve Morin, CTO, Nvent Data

Get an overview of the maturing Big Data ecosystem as companies move more towards real-time analytics tools that ingest, extract, translate, and then clean up data for analysis. You'll also get a look at a data ingestion pipeline architecture, how it has evolved over time, and its use cases in today's big data landscape.​

Cisco IT's Hadoop Journey by Robert Novak, Big Data Consulting Systems Engineer, Cisco

In this talk, you'll get insights into Cisco’s own Hadoop journey and how Cisco implemented a highly agile enterprise Hadoop platform, delivering multiple use cases including ETL migration, content management, smart analytics and compliance.

The Transformational Influence of Big Data in the Global Capital Markets by Paul Cassell, CIO & Daniel Bartucci, Director of Corporate Development, Pico

The business of financial and global capital management is bursting with hundreds of millions of transactions every day. Recent volatility in the financial markets is driving increased message traffic from electronic trading, stretching systems that simply aren’t equipped to handle such volume. With growing financial data sources and data types (such as social media, audio, and video), the need for big data technologies that can store, process and analyze this financial data is more important than ever. Join Paul Cassell, Pico CIO and former U.S. chief information officer for NYSE Euronext and the New York Stock Exchange, along with Daniel Bartucci, Director of Corporate Development, as they provide details on scalable, cost-effective, best-of-breed big data technologies that you can leverage for financial data management, regulation, risk analytics, and trading analytics. You’ll come away with a better understanding of how you can harvest and leverage this data so that you can stay one step ahead of your competitors.

​Secure Collaboration on Big Data: Locking Down Doesn't Mean Locking Out by Ted Dunning, Committer for Apache Mahout, Drill, & ZooKeeper Projects & Chief Application Architect, MapR

Mobile payments, online banking, smart kiosks, etc. are the platforms driving bank growth for the next 20 years. All of them produce gobs of data and all of them provide opportunities for fraudsters to steal. In order to keep up, new kinds of predictive analytical models will have to be built. In order to develop these new kinds of models, we need all hands on deck, both inside and outside of financial institutions. Unfortunately, cooperation on new modeling technologies is very difficult to do without sharing sensitive data in ways that just isn't acceptable.

I will describe some recently developed techniques that break this logjam. These methods are simple enough to deploy widely but provide very robust security against even the most advanced de-anonymization attacks.

Morgan Stanley's Big Data Journey by Erwan Le Doeuff, Vice President Information Technology, Risk and Security, Morgan Stanley

Morgan Stanley will highlight some of the exciting things they’re doing as they expand big data projects throughout the organization, including how to start out with test projects, choose open source projects, scale systems, and produce meaningful results.

Register at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932

50%-off code: SQLNYC

Industry experts will exchange Hadoop knowledge, share best practices, and discuss Hadoop use cases.

Tickets are half-price for SQL/NoSQL NYC Meetup members (join at http://www.NYCSQL.com) - we can attend a big data conference for just 24-bucks!

Registration includes free breakfast and a networking lunch!

Register NOW, seats are limited!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932

50%-off discount code: SQLNYC

Hear about real-world Hadoop delployments and other tales from the trenches of big data!

Speakers include:

• Vice President of IT for Morgan Stanley

• Chief Application Architect at MapR

• CTO of Nvent Data

• Cisco's Big Data Consulting Systems Engineer

• CIO of Pico

• Apache Mahout, Drill, & ZooKeeper Projects Committer

• CEO of Zaloni

Topics include:

• ​Morgan Stanley's Big Data Journey 

• Secure Collaboration on Big Data: Locking Down Doesn't Mean Locking Out

• Leverage a Hadoop Data Lake to Address Risk Data Aggregation and Risk Reporting

• The Transformational Influence of Big Data in the Global Capital Markets

• Odyssey: A Look at The Evolution of Big Data Ingestion Pipelines

• Cisco IT's Hadoop Journey

Register TODAY, seats are limited!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932
50%-off code: SQLNYC

Conference sessions:

Leverage a Hadoop Data Lake to address Risk Data Aggregation and Risk Reporting by Ben Sharma, CEO, Zaloni

Addressing risk data aggregation and risk reporting (RDARR) is a challenge today for many reasons, including data accuracy and integrity, data completeness, and ensuring that you have a data architecture that can support normal and high stress scenarios. During this presentation, Ben Sharma will address how a “managed” Hadoop data lake can serve as an ideal data acquisition hub for RDARR analytics and reporting. He will address architectural considerations and required capabilities.

Odyssey: A Look at The Evolution of Big Data Ingestion Pipelines by Steve Morin, CTO, Nvent Data

Get an overview of the maturing Big Data ecosystem as companies move more towards real-time analytics tools that ingest, extract, translate, and then clean up data for analysis. You'll also get a look at a data ingestion pipeline architecture, how it has evolved over time, and its use cases in today's big data landscape.​

Cisco IT's Hadoop Journey by Robert Novak, Big Data Consulting Systems Engineer, Cisco

In this talk, you'll get insights into Cisco’s own Hadoop journey and how Cisco implemented a highly agile enterprise Hadoop platform, delivering multiple use cases including ETL migration, content management, smart analytics and compliance.

The Transformational Influence of Big Data in the Global Capital Markets by Paul Cassell, CIO & Daniel Bartucci, Director of Corporate Development, Pico

The business of financial and global capital management is bursting with hundreds of millions of transactions every day. Recent volatility in the financial markets is driving increased message traffic from electronic trading, stretching systems that simply aren’t equipped to handle such volume. With growing financial data sources and data types (such as social media, audio, and video), the need for big data technologies that can store, process and analyze this financial data is more important than ever. Join Paul Cassell, Pico CIO and former U.S. chief information officer for NYSE Euronext and the New York Stock Exchange, along with Daniel Bartucci, Director of Corporate Development, as they provide details on scalable, cost-effective, best-of-breed big data technologies that you can leverage for financial data management, regulation, risk analytics, and trading analytics. You’ll come away with a better understanding of how you can harvest and leverage this data so that you can stay one step ahead of your competitors.

​Secure Collaboration on Big Data: Locking Down Doesn't Mean Locking Out by Ted Dunning, Committer for Apache Mahout, Drill, & ZooKeeper Projects & Chief Application Architect, MapR

Mobile payments, online banking, smart kiosks, etc. are the platforms driving bank growth for the next 20 years. All of them produce gobs of data and all of them provide opportunities for fraudsters to steal. In order to keep up, new kinds of predictive analytical models will have to be built. In order to develop these new kinds of models, we need all hands on deck, both inside and outside of financial institutions. Unfortunately, cooperation on new modeling technologies is very difficult to do without sharing sensitive data in ways that just isn't acceptable.

I will describe some recently developed techniques that break this logjam. These methods are simple enough to deploy widely but provide very robust security against even the most advanced de-anonymization attacks.

Morgan Stanley's Big Data Journey by Erwan Le Doeuff, Vice President Information Technology, Risk and Security, Morgan Stanley

Morgan Stanley will highlight some of the exciting things they’re doing as they expand big data projects throughout the organization, including how to start out with test projects, choose open source projects, scale systems, and produce meaningful results.

Register at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932

50%-off code: SQLNYC

results.description:
New York Passive House (NYPH) is pleased to be Urban Green Council's (UGC) event partner for this exciting event. 

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE - 


What will it take to bring the largest residential Passive House in the world from conception to completion? Join project leads from Related, Hudson Companies, Handel Architects, and Steven Winter Associates for an in-depth presentation on Cornell University’s high-rise residential tower, designed to Passive House standards and currently under construction on Roosevelt Island. Part of their new tech campus, the 26-story building will house students and faculty members in 350 apartments, making it both the largest and tallest PH building in the world upon completion.

UGC thanks event partners AIA New York and New York Passive House (NYPH)

SPEAKERS

Lois Arena, PE


Senior Mechanical Engineer, Steven Winter Associates, Inc.

Ms. Arena has over 20 years experience in building science, including work with both new and existing buildings. She holds both US and international Passive House consultant certifications and is currently consulting on multiple Passive House projects.

Luke Falk
Sustainability Manager, Related

Mr. Falk supports the implementation of Related’s corporate sustainability strategy, which includes enhancing the energy performance and resilience of new and existing buildings, incorporating innovative technologies into Related’s development portfolio, and managing the LEED certification process for new developments. 

Deborah Moelis, AIA
Senior Associate, Handel Architects

Ms. Moelis currently serves as Project Manager for Cornell University’s new residential tower under construction on the Roosevelt Island campus. Previously, she oversaw construction of Millennium Place, a 256-unit residential building in downtown Boston, as well as design and construction of Aire, a 42-story 315-unit residential tower on Manhattan’s Upper West Side.

Arianna Sacks Rosenberg
Senior Project Manager, The Hudson Companies, Inc.

Ms. Rosenberg has over 9 years of experience in real estate development and design, and oversees a broad range of residential and commercial development projects in Manhattan and Brooklyn, including the development of the Cornell Tech residential building.

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE -
results.name: Cornell Tech: Passive House Reaches New Heights (UGC Event)

results.name: Rock Climbers - Forest Play School

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change
Let's get together for some socializing and exercise!

results.description:
The elite parenting center at the 92nd Street Y hosts a weekly new parent get-together tackling a new topic each week.  It's an amazing space to learn and socialize with other new parents who are facing many of the same challenges as you are.

New Parent Get-Together: A warm welcome to all new parents and their babies up to a year-old.  Join in and drop-in for a lively discussion and gathering each week to share, learn, and make new friends.  Wednesday's from 10:30am - noon.  

The new parent get-together is mainly attended by new moms, but extremely welcoming to all dads.

Price: $10 per week.  Come when you can, no registration required

Sep 16: Choosing Child Care

Sept 23: Bonding as a Family

Sept 30: Grandparents, Good advice/Bad Advice

Oct 7: Financial Planning

Oct 14: Baby's Temperament

Oct 21: Baby Sleep

Oct 28: Can you spoil your baby?

Nov 4: Traveling with your baby?

Nov 11: Gender expectations

Nov 18: Safety Tips

Dec 2: Introducing Solids

results.description: Wed. Nov. 4. Bronx Botanical Garden. Forecast is for a beautiful day -- sunny skies and high temperature around 70. Fall foliage should finally be at its peak. We'll also take a look at the Rose Garden (yes, some roses are still in bloom!), The new Native Plant Garden, and the Perennial Garden, as well as walk through NYC's only primeval forest. Around 2 miles at a very leisurely pace. Take the 10:25 Harlem Line train from Grand Central, arriving at the "Botanical Garden" station at 10:45. Alternatively, take the 4 or D subway to "Bedford Park Blvd." and then the #26 bus east to the Mosholu Gate entrance. We'll meet just inside the Gate at 10:47. Admission to the Garden is free on Wednesdays, but the conservatory (optional) will set you back $25 ($22 for seniors). If driving, park in the parking facility by the station ($12) or on a nearby street (free). No coordination of rides. The 3:37 train gets you back to Grand Central at 3:59, or you can take the bus and subway back. Lunch in the cafeteria, or bring your own. Please call or email me to let me know you are coming, and if you have any questions. No need to let me know if you are not coming. No pets; no smoking. Bob Susser[masked]; [masked]
results.name: Bronx Botanical Garden

results.description:
ok all the weather is going to be perfect for some mid week exercise ,

 so if your free and want to enjoy some small town living  along side some beautiful fall leaves  then come along . ill wait inside the starbucks in scarsdale  Train station which I believe is the 1st hidden gem spot on this tour .. also I like to start our tours by a bathroom  so everyone can use facility before we head out walking :) Scarsdale is a very cute town  they have recently installed a parking garage next to train  and some long term  meters which will help with parking issues  we will head out to see a few of the speciality stores in town  as we walk to the path and then see some amazing fall foliage and little bridges  which are picture perfect . so I know this is short notice but  charge up your cameras , lace up your sneakers and come learn a bit about this charming town & enjoy a few hours for your self . BRING SMALL MONEY  FOR PARKING & IF YOU WANT TO BUY ANYTHING ALONG THE TOUR  .

results.description:
Hello,

7v7 game, 90min+, bring a white & black tee-shirt.

Don't be late, we start on time!


This long running pick-up plays in Chinatown and has a storied history. The game has been going 12+ years, and was born by a group of Irish, English, Scottish and German expats who needed a mid-week footballing outlet. The group has now expanded to include players from around a dozen countries.

The group is looking for additional players to complement the game. The match is played in a sporting yet competitive spirit. This is for seasoned players - NO beginners please.

A good attitude, positional sense and a preference for passing is a must. We usually play for 1.5 hours year round.


Someone usually brings pinnies, but bring a white and black top just in case.

Note: RSVP is required to attend the game. There are a number of regulars who attend each week in addition to the meetup list - not all players are listed on the meetup.

See you there.
results.name: Chinatown Pick-up Wednesdays @12:00pm

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014


--------------------------------------------------------------------

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 1:00 PM – 2:30 PM

Day: Wednesdays

Where: Room #102, Freeport Recreation Center

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520

Contact: Nan, [masked],[masked]

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card.  The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

 -------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.
results.how_to_find_us: The Freeport Rec Center is just west of the Meadowbrook Parkway on Merrick Road
results.name: Bodhi Meditation  - Freeport Long Island (FREE**)

results.description:
Get early access to Dr.Schneider's "Orbital Mechanics Workshop. Dr.Schneider has been 30+ years in the outer space military defense industry and is now offering a 2 hour workshop on "Orbital Mech" a NewSpace NYC Workshop. Topics covered will include:

• All common satellite orbits, how they look, their functions and what industry uses them for today. 

• Satellite ground patterns and how ground stations interact for data transfers. 


• Access to free software to work with any of the orbits presented and the ability to make them your own. 


• And much much more of course.

See Garret's #SpaceTalk video on YouTube to hear his story in the defense space industry: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6XzMIgLH9ik

*In this preview, the workshop is 100% free. All we ask in return is feedback on your experience and a couple other answers to some of our questions. 

*This event may be at Columbia Startup Lab or it may be somewhere on the Columbia University campus. We'll update with location Nov 2nd.
results.how_to_find_us: In the Civic Hall "Orange Room". Message Mike Mooring on Slack if you have trouble finding\/getting into the location. Ask Mike here in a comment to be added to Slack if you're not yet in our channel.

results.description:
Comic time! 

This week: Zombie Apples and Vampire Ponies

http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/f/f8/Comic_issue_32_cover_A.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20150422044435

So pack your books and come over to this week's meetup for Friendship is Magic #32 &33 (descriptions and download links below)


Friendship is Magic #32

One thousand years ago, when Princess Celestia banished Nightmare Moon to the moon, remnants of their battle—meteorites tainted by Nightmare Moon's magic—drifted through space. A thousand years later, the meteorites fall to earth and crash outside Sweet Apple Acres in the middle of the night. When Applejack goes to investigate, she notices apples falling out of the trees earlier than they're expected to. The apples, affected by the magic of the meteorites, suddenly come to life and swarm over Applejack. Will the she be able to stop them ?


Written by: Thom Zahler
Artwork by: Tony Fleecs

Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friendship-Is-Magic-32/digital-comic/251763

Friendship is magic #33

After the ponies restrain the berserk Flutterbat, Twilight carries out the second part of her plan. Similar to her plan with the Breezies, she casts a spell—using Flutterbat as a template—to transform herself and the rest of her friends into vampire fruit bat-ponies, but with their personalities and intelligence intact. As the Cutie Mark Crusaders keep an eye on Flutterbat, the transformed ponies fly off. Will they be able to stop the apple invasion ?

Written by: Thom Zahler

Artwork by: Tony Fleecs

Download link:  https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friendship-Is-Magic-33/digital-comic/260116

******************************************************

Due to colder weather we will be meeting at the Atrium rather than the usual place in Central Park.

601 Lexington Ave – Btw. 52nd & 53rd Street – Take the 6 train to 51st Street. The building itself is actually connected to the 53rd Street E/M/6 MTA subway station and is one of New York's largest skyscrapers.

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.

Please bring $4 cash to the game. 

• RSVPs close by 3:15PM on the day of the game. 

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.

results.description:
Join us on November 4th to hear Yonggang Hu, Distinguished Engineer and Chief Architect talk about Born-in-the-Cloud Architecture.

Bigger data, complex compute requirements, and cost/resource constraints are driving organizations to use cloud infrastructure. Yet existing compute- and data-intensive applications are not often designed to take advantage of infrastructure as a service. Firms must re-architect their applications to be cloud-native or "born-in-the cloud". Using analytics case studies as examples, Yonggang will explain the born-in-the-cloud architecture, and the opportunities and challenges that it brings.

Yonggang will address the following agenda:
- Introduction
- Industry and Technology Context
- Cloud Native Architecture
- Run and Manage Cloud Native Apps
- Use Cases and Benefits


Come network, have some snacks, and enjoy a great presentation. See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Room 1219
results.name: Born-in-the-Cloud Architecture: What it is and Why You Should Care

results.description:
Financial Fitness NYC is a discussion and support group centered around all aspects of personal finance. Each meeting will be centered around support and encouragement of each attendee's specific financial questions, challenges and goals. These discussions will also spark in-depth analysis of topics include budgeting, eliminating debt, saving for emergencies, investing for retirement, everyday smart spending, large purchases like cars and houses, avoiding dangerous financial products and habits, insurance essentials, money and marriage, money and kids, and generous giving. 

Don't know how well you're handling your finances? Take this short quiz and find out! If you didn't score very high, or didn't score as high as you thought you would, I guarantee that these meetings will help. 

Meetings are held every 1st and 3rd Wednesdays of every month.

See the website for complete meeting schedule and all locations. Please subscribe to the mailing list to get updates on future meetings and other important updates and content.
results.how_to_find_us: After signing in at the lobby desk, take the elevator to the 10th floor and follow the signs. The lobby closes at 6:00 so please arrive on time. Text 718-839-0103 for questions.

As long promised, a new adventuring group is here! Come join us to learn the basics of the game and create your character. Adventurers new to both Fifth Edition and D&D as a whole are welcome, as well as veteran adventurers looking for glory.

Character sheets and pencils will be provided, but players should bring their own set of dice and a copy of the Player's Handbook, if they own one. We will have the choice of using any character options from the Player's Handbook, Elemental Evil, or the Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide- all of which will be available.

If everything goes well we will begin a new campaign Wednesday night as an introduction, but those who can't it and would like to join in later shouldn't worry about missing out.

If you have any questions, message Chris for details.

results.description:
In this Meetup we'll highlight the certificate programs offered at Pace University. These programs are some of the most comprehensive and leading edge courses in the NY Metropolitan area. Attendees will learn about new features and technologies along with tips & tricks in Web Design, Digital Graphic Design and our new Advanced Photoshop course available at Pace University. Explore how you can advance your skills to the next level!

CERTIFICATE IN DIGITAL GRAPHIC DESIGN 

• End to end process in Digital Graphic Design.

• Understand the latest in graphic technologies, utilizing best practices. Learn how to effectively use digital assets in workflow processes.

• Design and build multi-page products and content  for a variety of different platforms.

CERTIFICATE IN CMS WEB DESIGN WITH WORDPRESS

• New features and workflows of Photoshop and Illustrator to plan and design a responsive website.

• Dreamweaver and Bootstrap, PHP and MySQL to add dynamic functionality to the website and connect with a database.

• Lifecycle of websites including their creation, management, distribution and publishing.

• This program cover advanced features and includes use of HTML, CSS, PHP and Adobe tools: Photoshop, Illustrator and Dreamweaver. 

CERTIFICATE IN DIGITAL PHOTOGRAPHY AND RETOUCHING 

This program will include a strong command and mastery of digital skills ranging from workflows including camera to digital asset management to final outputs for print and digital media.


• Adobe tool integration and workflows across Photoshop, Photoshop Lightroom, digital photography and an introduction to 3D integration. 

• Learn advanced Photoshop techniques used by leading professionals to optimize their digital images. Learn how to create photomontages, 3D techniques, retouching and special effects.

results.description:
Hi Everyone,


As the trip to Killington gets closer and the weather gets colder, it's time for us to get together for another happy hour and get to know each other's faces before we head up to Vermont for a weekend.


Please use this as a chance to meet other people, ask me questions and coordinate your carpools.


Since this event will take place at Bryant Park, there's an ice skating rink for those of you who want to go ice skating later. Steph
At around 7:30 we will raffle off a free lift ticket voucher for Mount Snow.
results.name: Pre-Killington Snowboard Trip Happy Hour & Meet and Greet

results.description:
>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.

OP LOUNGE, THE ATTITUDE-FREE NETWORKING SERIES, REVISITS A FORMER HELL’S KITCHEN CARRIAGE HOUSE.

On Wednesday, November 4, ascend the stairs to the upper lounge at Therapy, the wittily named Hell’s Kitchen watering hole that is housed in a former carriage house.

It’s no secret that today’s economic climate makes it vital to connect with others socially and professionally. That’s why Out Professionals … OP.LYNX, our dynamic women’s network … and OP.PRIME, the network for up-and-coming LGBT professionals, are all coming together tonight.

Joined by members of the Greenwich Village Chelsea Chamber of Commerce, we enjoy an evening-long Happy Hour: Two-for-one wines, draft beers and well drinks — and $2 off everything else.

On November 4, grab some business cards and head into Therapy (“Solid and cozy; short on ostentation.” — The New York Times).

WHERE

The upstairs lounge at Therapy, 348 West 52nd Street (Eighth-Ninth Avenues). Subway: No. 1 or the C/E to 50th Street; N/Q/R to 49th Street; B/D/F/M to 47th-50th Streets.

WHAT’S UP

Networking and socializing from 6 p.m. Two-for-one wines, draft beers and well drinks — and $2 off everything else — until 9 p.m.

ADMISSION

Nonmember, $10. Pre-registered, dues-paying Member of OP or GVCCC, free. OP or GVCCC Member at the door, $5. Advance registration closes at noon on November 4. Print and pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks! Walk-ins welcome; cash only at the door.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER!

Enjoy a 12-month individual Out Professionals membership (new or renewal) PLUS guaranteed admission to tonight’s event for just $65. And remember, that buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing. Order here.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Mix at Therapy!

results.description:
Kodo (Japanese Traditional Incense Ceremony) is a traditional amusement with history dating back to more than 1400 years ago. Kodo expresses its uniqueness by enjoying the scent through both literature and distinctive Japanese ancient culture. Due to its historical background, Kodo has long been closed to the public and is known to be a refined art played by the few chosen people within the upper class society

Hikaru O-mi became Iyemoto in 2000 for the family who has been practicing the art of incense for almost 1,400 years. He has mastered the art of incense, tea, flower arrangement and poem making by age 17. He will demonstrate and lecture on the art.
results.name: Japanese Incense Ceremony

results.description:
Wednesday Night Zumba experience with Certified Zumba Instructor Miriam at the Pearl Studios

There is a changing room on the premises and water provided. All you need to bring is a towel and be ready to get your workout on...

We look forward to meeting you.
results.how_to_find_us: Studio 401
results.name: Zumba with Miriam

results.description:
November is the perfect month to cozy up with a feel-good read over red wine in a rustic atmosphere, right?! Right:-) Here's a bit about the book (which can be found on Amazon here: http://amzn.to/1gg9LGi)

"The dirt-poor Texas sailor who offers dinner to a runaway in Central Park. The Midwestern college girl who stops a cop in Times Square for restaurant advice. The Brooklyn man on a midnight subway who helps a weary tourist find her way to Chinatown. The Columbia University graduate student who encounters an unexpected object of beauty at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
A public place in the world's greatest city. A chance meeting of strangers. A marriage. Heart of the City tells the remarkable true stories of nine ordinary couples--from the 1940s to the present--whose matchmaker was the City of New York."

As a reminder, if you RSVP yes and your plans change, please change your RSVP immediately to give folks on the waitlist a chance to prepare accordingly. Thanks, and happy reading!
results.name: Discuss " Heart Of The City" at a HK Wine Bar!

results.description:
Please note: Meetups are now $2.00. Cheap! 

Join us for an evening of digital printing expertise. But please, don't let this stuff scare you! We're making it understandable for all levels of users!

So, find out what it takes to make great prints from your digital photographs with tonight's guest speaker, digital printing expert, author and educator, Tom P. Ashe. We've also signed up Adoramapix to present on using an online printing service! Learn more about printing from the experts!

About Tom:

Photographer, educator, and consultant Tom P. Ashe received his BS from RIT and his MS from RMIT University in Melbourne. He has been teaching color management and digital printmaking as an adjunct professor at the School of Visual Arts (SVA) in NYC since 2003. He has also been Associate Chair of the Masters in Digital Photography program at SVA since it started in 2007. His over 25 years of industry experience has included positions with Polaroid and Eastman Kodak, X-Rite Photo Marketing and the MAC Group. Focal Press released his first book Color Management & Quality Output in 2014.

About Adoramapix:

Located right here in Brooklyn, AdoramaPix has been serving the needs of the photographic community for over a decade. Well known for the superior quality of our prints and our excellent customer service, we have become the lab of choice for professional photographers and savvy consumers all over the country. Here at AdoramaPix we're as passionate about pictures as you are, and when we make your pictures look good - we look good!

Please note: Meetups are now $2.00. Cheap! This helps us with the annual cost of maintaining our Meetup page and production costs. Thanks for your understanding!
results.name: What You Should Know About Managing Color & Printing w/ Color Expert Tom P. Ashe

results.description:
Let's meet up and explore the many local restaurants in Nyack!

Looking for a healthy meal that doesn't compromise on taste? By utilizing the freshest ingredients and the best Carribean spices available, Nyack Main Essentials presents a balanced alternative to fast food. Their food is all natural and free of MSG, artificial flavors, and chemicals. They are also 100% vegan, using no animal products.

To drool more at their food, click this link: </a><a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/main-essentials-nyack">http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/main-essentials-nyack

results.description:
Note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Dave directly at [masked].

Every Wednesday NYSN founder Dave Cervini welcomes members from a dozen different Meet Up and social groups to come together to network, connect, mix, mingle and socialize.  There is always a very casual vibe, no loud music or overcrowded rooms and a friendly staff ready to welcome you and introduce you to others.  St. Pat's is a brand new bar and grill in the heart of midtown and is easy to get to from most subways.  Join us for a quick cocktail or stay the whole night!Here is what to expect:

-Doors open at 6pm. -We will be set up on the 2nd floor with name tags, event info and a staff member who will introduce you to others at the party.-Around 7:30pm we will do a fun ice breaker game for your chance to win prizes!-Happy Hour drink prices all night $3-$10 cocktails-Music played at conversational levels all night. 

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those who attend come on their own

How should I dress? Business casual (most come from work)

What is the age range? Mostly 20's -40's (some 50's).  If that is important  to you we promise there will be enough of your peer group to hang with!

How long will it last?  Until the last person leaves (usually 9:30-10pm)

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].
results.name: After Work Wednesday's: Our Weekly Happy Hour & New Member Welcome Party

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
According to Forbes, 8 out of 10 small businesses fail in the first year! Having a good brand, great skills and special knowledge about your industry are not enough. 

With careful planning, starting and running your own business successfully is entirely possible - even in challenging times. Many companies lack capital at the outset, yet find success by following smart business management strategies. These workshops focus on what is required to start your own business and how you can make a little money go a long way by planning carefully and using proven strategies for achieving success. 

Topics covered in this session: Starting from scratch, finding your niche, looking at your skills, explore various ways to help you select your business, looking at your motivators, the principles to start a business and succeed, options to start a business (moonlighting, part time, spin off, etc..), setting up your business, equipping your business, legal issues, your business format (partnership, Corp. etc..) and market research.

Please note that this workshop is part of a 2 session workshop series that may be taken individually. The subsequent lecture will compliment this one.

CAPACITY IS LIMITED TO 20 PEOPLE - This is a multi group event. The RSVP list on this page is only a portion of those actually attending. 

Topics covered in the next session: Sales and marketing, getting to know your customers, who is your competition, managing your business, your professional business image, time management, how much to charge/setting prices, keeping books, mistakes to avoid, dealing with failure, startup business plan, web presence, internet surfing and Q & A

Led by Roger Kuperways Ph.D., life-long entrepreneur, investor, business coach, advisor and adjunct professor of entrepreneurship at NYU. He built a multi-million dollar empire from scratch and has many years of experience in a variety of businesses and industries. He also lectures at trade shows and corporate events on Start-ups and Business issues.

MUST PREPAY FOR RSVP TO BE VALID!

Prepaid registration is: $25
$40 cash at the door, without a ticket (if not sold out)

Click here to purchase and print your ticket:
</a><a href="http://bit.ly/1Nqep0y">http://bit.ly/1Nqep0y

Remember to bring your ticket. 

Our past workshops have all sold out so don't wait! 
Tickets should be purchased in advance.

============================== 
Comments from recent events:

Very informative ...The workshop makes you look at what you are doing and where you want to focus - Robin Antar 

Very satisfied - Kamilla Sun

The info based on Roger's experience was very stimulating - Deborah Schull

I very much enjoyed the workshop. I think you gave a very simple and clear overview of what one needs to do when venturing into a start-up. The side benefit, of course, is the input from those attending. You never know what unexpected tips you might get!  Thank you for giving your time to do this.  -- JB Manton

Loved it! Definitely appreciated all of the members' different insight on each other's ideas. Very informative class. Dr. Kuperways was engaging and funny, and I even came out of this meetup with a new venture idea :) Looking forward to seeing the members in another meetup. -- Paloma Garcia

Thank you for a very interesting meeting.  The environment and the participants were very welcoming. Lots of good topics, insights, experiences shared. It was really great. Of course I look forward to attending the next meetup. -- Lucy Torres

I very much enjoyed the workshop and would be interested in attending the one regarding creating a business plan.

I thought you handled the group well last evening. I liked your equation about when you can quit your job. I didn't do that this time, and paying the price. -- Tom Graham

As usual it was very interesting and I gleaned some valuable insights as well as meeting some great people - Please let me know of any other meetings you have planned -- Fay Julia Meyer

Awesome! -- GabiLovve

Thank you for a very informative session tonight! Lots of good topics discussed and I look forward to attending this Thursday’s  meetup! -- Eddie Gomez

A knowledgeable host and curious participants and a very welcoming environment ! -- Ify E

“ This Meetup was sooooo informative. I walked away with a lot of tips, information and was able to network with other interesting participants. Looking forward to the August 12th Meetup for more of the same!! ” -- Linda Dixon

The startup meeting, I thought was great! Guidance - tips - references - take action - exercises - general layout of meeting -  jam packed full of great concepts --- Aideen Sinnott

============================== 

VOLUNTEERING: As always, with such big events, we will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me.

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group

============================== 
EVENT SPONSOR: New York Office Suites

We provide furnished, equipped, and staffed Manhattan office space featuring amenities and services to support your business in vibrant Midtown New York. NYC Office Suites is committed to delivering service excellence and flexible office contract terms. Our contracts carry a term length of as little as 3 months. Our flexibility allows companies to match their New York office requirements with their professional needs.

We offer many New York office space sublease configurations, including executive offices, multi-person offices, coworking, shared office space for rent, flexible workspace, team / project offices and cubicles.


==============================

Want more business from events? If you are interested in sponsoring our group or this event, please call, email me or go to http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm

results.name: Essentials for Starting Your Business - Workshop - Part 1

results.description:
According to Forbes, 8 out of 10 small businesses fail in the first year! Having a good brand, great skills and special knowledge about your industry are not enough. 

With careful planning, starting and running your own business successfully is entirely possible - even in challenging times. Many companies lack capital at the outset, yet find success by following smart business management strategies. These workshops focus on what is required to start your own business and how you can make a little money go a long way by planning carefully and using proven strategies for achieving success. 

Topics covered in this session: Starting from scratch, finding your niche, looking at your skills, explore various ways to help you select your business, looking at your motivators, the principles to start a business and succeed, options to start a business (moonlighting, part time, spin off, etc..), setting up your business, equipping your business, legal issues, your business format (partnership, Corp. etc..) and market research.

Please note that this workshop is part of a 2 session workshop series that may be taken individually. The subsequent lecture will compliment this one.

CAPACITY IS LIMITED TO 20 PEOPLE - This is a multi group event. The RSVP list on this page is only a portion of those actually attending. 

Topics covered in the next session: Sales and marketing, getting to know your customers, who is your competition, managing your business, your professional business image, time management, how much to charge/setting prices, keeping books, mistakes to avoid, dealing with failure, startup business plan, web presence, internet surfing and Q & A

Led by Roger Kuperways Ph.D., life-long entrepreneur, investor, business coach, advisor and adjunct professor of entrepreneurship at NYU. He built a multi-million dollar empire from scratch and has many years of experience in a variety of businesses and industries. He also lectures at trade shows and corporate events on Start-ups and Business issues.

MUST PREPAY FOR RSVP TO BE VALID!

Prepaid registration is: $25
$40 cash at the door, without a ticket (if not sold out)

results.description:
This meetup is about coming together to hear what we all are working on, pitching new ideas, discussing our needs to begin and finish projects, and helping to make it happen.  Please be sure to answer the RSVP questions fully to help ensure this meetup is successful.


During our time together, there will be an allocated time where each member gets an opportunity to introduce him/herself and their experience level. Those who are ready to launch projects/or are looking for writing collaborators will have three minutes to pitch her/his idea to the room, with (if needed) an extra minute to mention above and below the line needs in terms of crew, locations, extras, support, phone calls, whatever. Following the pitches, we will then break into an informal session of conversation, where we can talk among ourselves about the pitches and our experience, offer advice, get to know one another, form crews, etc.


We firmly believe that you don't need money to make films, and creative projects, all you really need is friends.


Let's do it.
results.name: PITCH, NETWORK, PLAN, CREATE PROJECTS

Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. MINY Toastmasters is proud to be one of the 14,650 clubs in 126 countries that make up Toastmasters International Global network of meeting locations.

MINY Toastmasters provide a supportive and positive learning experience in which members are empowered to develop their communication and leadership skills, resulting in greater self-confidence and personal growth. By regularly giving speeches, gaining feedback, leading teams and guiding others to achieve their goals in a supportive atmosphere, leaders emerge from the Toastmasters program. Our goal at MINY Toastmasters is to empower individuals to become more effective communicators and leaders.

results.description:
DigitalOcean and Deis Deploy Night #1

If you haven’t heard of Deis, it’s a Docker-native platform that makes application deploy, rollback, log aggregation and config management super simple. And if you have heard of Deis, come see what’s new. A lot has changed in the last year!


Join the Deis core team at DigitalOcean and get hands-on experience with CoreOS, Kubernetes and Deis for Deploy Night #1. We will even help you migrate your app! And if you’ve never created a container, come see how Deis makes it easy!


Agenda

6:00pm: Arrival


6:30pm: Dinner and drinks [sponsored by DigitalOcean]


7:00pm: Kickoff presentation by Chris Armstrong, Deis Core Maintainer 


7:15pm: Tutorial: Provision a CoreOS cluster on DigitalOcean


7:30pm: Working session: Install Deis and deploy a sample app 


8:30pm: Lightning talks and continued hacking 


9:30pm: Show and tell and closing remarks
results.name: DigitalOcean and Deis Deploy Night #1

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.
results.name: FREE West African Dance Class!!

results.description:
Note the earlier time! 

We'll meet in front of MP Taverna for a loop run along Buckout St to Mercy College, through Dobbs Ferry and back. Afterward, everyone is welcome to stop in at MP Taverna for drinks and/or eats.

Details about the run

Route: As the sun is setting earlier now, we’ll leave promptly at 6 pm from the parking lot in front of MP Taverna. We'll head south on Buckout St and Half Moon Lane and then we'll use the little wooded short cut to the Ardsley Train Station. We'll run past the station, veer right onto the lit walking path into the Mercy College campus, and through the campus, exiting on to Broadway at Landing Dr. We'll head south on Broadway and then we'll weave through Ardsley Park, taking Langdon to Belmont to Field Terrace to Osceola, before exiting right onto Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A tentative route map is available <a>here</a>. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: MP Taverna parking lot (One Bridge St, Irvington, NY)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]

What is this: We are piggy-backing off of IDDC's 100 Black Owned Restaurants list. We will try to visit as many as we can. It's just a fun thing to try to do.

Price: Price will be whatever the restaurants costs. The price ($5) you pay you to rsvp, ($4.55) will be deducted from the bill for everyone. Tax & grat will be split evenly. Cash is always king at restaurants. There are no refunds.

Limitations: Each restaurant will be limited to 8 or less

Time: Arrival time is accurate above. 

No-Shows: If you no-show, you will not be refunded and not allowed to participate in our future restaurant fun.

Can't Make It?: If someone is willing to take your spot, then they may swap your $5.

Restaurants: This is the actual list from IDDCs. If you have recommendations for the next spot, please let me know. Also, you do NOT have to be black to come, of course not.

*We are going for happy hour. Happy hour is from 5-7pm. We will arrive at 5:45-6pm and at least get to enjoy 1 hour of happy hour.

results.description:
Come join us for a night of board gaming fun. We play all sorts of board games and card games. We tend to play more euro games so please keep that in mind. Bringing a game is not necessary, but if you have one you want to play bring it along.

Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.


We have permission from the restaurant owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consumes something. At least a soda. The restaurant also has a bakery attached with treats.

We play in the restaurant; to get there, you enter the bakery walk to the back, then make a right. There you'll find the restaurant, we are located by the front windows.

• The bakery is located across the street from Mitchell's restaurant. There is a lighted OPEN sign on the window.

• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.

results.description:
Hi everyone

After the success of last year's cookie bakeoff, we have been trying to find a way to step it up a notch.   While visiting our good friends at St Gambrinus not long ago, Heather (one of the owners) suggested a meatball cook off.  She said we could have a lot of fun with meatballs!  I agreed, so that is how we have come to bring this spectacular event to Brooklyn!

If you are a meatball maker and would like to participate, please indicate "Meatballer" when you answer the question required to RSVP. Closer to the event, I'll reach out to all meatballers to get information on their balls. If you don't plan on making anything, don't worry, you can still participate because everyone gets to be a judge (unless you don't eat meat and assuming there are no non-meat entries).  Ball maker requirements:

• Make enough meatballs to allow all the attendees to sample (if you can make smaller ones, that would be best since it would be hard to eat a lot of meatballs and drink beer)  We will probably have around 40 people there.

• Review the St Gambrinus beer menu and have a recommended beer pairing for your meatballs . If you want a particular beer, let me know and I'll see if Heather and Ray can order it and have it on tap.

• Your meatball must have a name so please me the name of it beforehand and make it clever

• Please let me know if your meatball has nuts in it or if it's a specialty meatball, like vegan, gluten free or something.

• We will start the sampling and voting at between 7:15-7:30 pm to give everyone a chance to get there and give the meatballs a chance to heat up.  We will have warming trays to put your meatballs in, so if you bring a couple of large Ziploc bags with the meatballs, arrive early enough to give them time to heat up.

 
All meatball makers will receive a medal and there will be special awards for the winner! Let me know if you have any questions and I look forward to seeing you and tasting some delicious meatballs on November 4th!

Cheers,

Bill
results.name: Let's have a meatball cookoff in Brooklyn!

results.description:
We occasionally cover other data-related topics at our Meetup. In the past we have touched upon MongoDB and MySQL in comparison to PostgreSQL. This Meetup introduces another database called CockroachDB, presented by Peter Mattis of Cockroach Labs.

CockroachDB is a distributed SQL database built on top of a distributed, transactionally consistent KV store. This talk will discuss some of the internal details of building an SQL database - comparing PostgreSQL and CockroachDB storage of SQL data, and the challenges of performing schema changes in a distributed system.
results.name: Introduction to CockroachDB
